(base) Wel may men knowe / but it be a fool
(base) That euery part. is diryued from his hool
(base) For nature / hath nat taken his bigynnyng
(base) Of no partie / or of cantel of a thyng
(base) But of a thyng. that parfit is and stable
(base) Descendynge so / til it be corrumpable
(base) And therfore / for his wise purueiaunce
(base) He hath / so wel biset his ordinaunce
(base) That specis of thynges / and progressions
(base) Shullen enduren / by successions
(base) And noght eterne / withouten any lye
(base) This maist thow vnderstonde / and seen at Iye
(base) ¶ Loo the ook / that hath so long a norisshynge
(base) Fro the tyme / that it first gynneth sprynge
(base) And hath so long a lyf / as ye may see
(base) Yet at the laste / wasted is the tree
(base) ¶ Considreth eek / how that the harde stoon
(base) Vnder oure foot on which we ryde and goon
(base) It wasteth / as it lyth by the weye
(base) The brode Ryuer / som tyme wexeth dreye
(base) The grete townes / se we wane and wende
(base) Thanne se ye / that al this thyng hath ende
(base) Of man and womman / se we wel also
(base) That nedeth / in oon of thise termes two
(base) This is to seyn / in youthe / or ellis age
(base) He moot be deed / the kyng as shal a page
(base) Som in his bed / som in the depe see
(base) Som in the large feeld / as ye may se
(base) Ther helpeth noght al gooth that ilke weye
(base) Thanne may I seyn / that al this thyng moot deye
(base) What maketh this but Iuppiter the kyng
(base) That is Prince / and cause of alle thyng
(base) Conuertyng al vnto his propre welle
(base) From which it is diryued sooth to telle
(base) And heer agayns / no creature on lyue
(base) Of no degree / auailleth for to stryue
(base) ¶ Thanne is it wisdom / as it thynketh me
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) To maken vertu / of necessitee
(base) And take it wel / that we may nat eschue
(base) And nameliche / that to vs alle is due
(base) And who so gruccheth oght he dooth folye
(base) And rebel is / to hym that al may gye
(base) And certeinly / a man hath moost honour
(base) To dyen / in his excellence and flour
(base) Whan he is siker / of his goode name
(base) Thanne hath he doon / his freend ne hym no shame
(base) And gladder oghte / his freend been of his deeth
(base) Whan with honour / yolden is vp his breeth
(base) Than whan his name / apalled is for age
(base) For al forgeten is his vasselage
(base) Thanne is it best as for a worthy fame
(base) To dyen / whan he is best of name
(base) ¶ The contrarie of al this / is wilfulnesse
(base) Why grucchen we / why haue we heuynesse
(base) That goode Arcite / of chiualrie flour
(base) Departed is / with duetee / and with honour
(base) Out of this foule prison / of this lyf
(base) Why gruccheth heere / his cosyn and his wyf /
(base) Of his welfare / that loueth hem so weel
(base) Kan he hem thank nay god woot neuer a deel
(base) That bothe his soule / and eek hem self offende
(base) And yet they mowe / hir lustes nat amende
(base) ¶ What may I conclude / of this longe serye
(base) But after wo / I rede vs to be merye
(base) And thanken Iuppiter / of al his grace
(base) And er we / departen from this place
(base) I rede we make / of sorwes two
(base) O parfit Ioye / lastynge euere mo
(base) And loketh now / wher moost sorwe is her Inne
(base) Ther wol I first amenden and bigynne
(base) ¶ Suster quod he / this is my ful assent
(base) With al thauys / heer of my parlement
(base) That gentil Palamon / youre owene knyght
(base) That serueth yow / with wyl and herte myght
(base) And euere hath doon / syn ye first hym knewe
(base) That ye shal of youre grace vpon hym rewe
(base) And taken hym / for housbond and for lord
(base) Leen me youre hond / for this is oure acord
(base) Lat se now / of youre wommanly pitee
(base) He is / a kynges brother sone pardee
(base) And thogh he were / a poure Bachiler
(base) Syn he hath serued yow / so many a yeer
(base) And had for yow / so greet aduersitee
(base) It moste been considred / leueth me
(base) For gentil mercy / oghte to passen right
(base) ¶ Thanne seyde he thus / to Palamon the knyght
(base) I trowe / ther nedeth litel sermonyng
(base) To make yow / assente to this thyng
(base) Com neer / and taketh youre lady by the hond
(base) Bitwixe hem / was maad anon the bond
(base) That highte matrymoigne / or mariage
(base) By al the conseil / and the Baronage
(base) And thus / with alle blisse / and melodye
(base) Hath Palamon / ywedded Emelye
(base) And god / that al this world hath wroght
(base) Sende hym his loue / that hath it deere aboght
(base) For now is Palamon / in alle wele
(base) Lyuynge in blisse / in richesse / and in heele
(base) And Emelye / hym loueth so tendrely
(base) And he / hir serueth so gentilly
(base) That was ther no word hem bitwene
(base) Of Ialousie / or any oother teene
(base) Thus endeth Palamon / and Emelye
(base) And god saue / al this faire compaignye Amen
(base) ¶ Here is ended / the knyghtes tale
¶ Here be gynnih the ꝓprologgere of the Mellere
WHanne thee knyght hadde his tale told
In all the cvmpanye theer nas yong no oold
That they ne seyde it was a noble storie
And worthy to bee drawe in to memorie
And nameliche thee gentelis everichon
¶ Owre Ooste lowgh and swore so mote hee gon
This goht a Ryght vn bokelid is the Male
Lat see nov who schall tell annother tale
For trewly thee game is well be gvnne
Now telle yee sire Munk yif that ye cvnne
Sumwhat to quite wtith the knyght is tale
¶ The Melnere that for drvnken was al pale
So that vnnethe vppon his hors hee sat
Hee wolde avayle owther hood nor hat
No a bide no man for his curtesie
But in pilatis voys hee gan to crie
And swore by armes blood and be bonys
I can a noble tale fore the nonis
Wtith wyche I will now quite the knyght his tale
Owre Oost sawe that hee was drvnke of ale
And syde a byde Robin my leve brother
Svm better man schall tell vs first a nother
Abyde and late vs wirke thriftily
¶ By goddis sowle quod hee that will nowt I
For I will speke ore ellis goo my wey
Owre Oost seyde tell on thy tale a develwey
And oon and other his wit is over come
Now herkenyht qd the Melnere all ⁊ some
But ferst I make aprotestacioun
That I am drvncke I woot it bee my sown
And therfore yif I mysspeke ore say
Wyte it the wyin of sowthewerk I yow pray
And I will telle a legende and A lyif /
Bothe of a Carpenter and of his wyif
How that a clerk hath made hym cokewold
¶ The spake the Reve that heyghte oswold
Lete bee qd hee thy lewid harlotrie
It is a senne and eke a greet folye
To klepen any man that fowle name
And eke to brynge wyuis īn swich fame
Thow mayst I nowgh of other thyng sayn
This drvnken Myllere spak full sone a gayn
And seyde leue brother Osewold
Whoo hath no wyif hee is no cokewold
But I seye nowt therfore that thow art oon
There bene full gode wyuis manye oon
Why art thow angry wtith my tale now
I haue a wyif parde as well as thow
Yit ne wolde I fore thee Oxe in my plowgh
Take vppon me more thanne I nowgh
As demen of my self that I were oon
I will bee leue well that I am noon
An husbonde schall nowt been Inquesityf
Of goddis previte nowther of his wyif /
Sche awghtte nowt to yeve a cowntis as a Reve
¶ I warne the well it stant in owre be leve
Wee husbonde men yif wee leue well
Owre damys thyng schall wantte never adell
So wee may fyinde goddis foysown there
Of the remnawnt nedyht nowt to en quere
What scholde I more seye but thee Mellere
Hee ne wolde his wordis for no man forbere
But tolde his cherlis tale in his manere
Me for thynkyht that I schall reherce it here
¶ And therfore everi gentill wyght I preye
Demyht nowt for goddis loue that I seye
Of evell entente but fore I moot reherce
Here talis be they bettir or be they wersce
Or ellis to falce svm of my matere
And therfore who so lyst it nowt to here
Turne over thee leef and cheze another tale
For yee schall fynde I nowe greet and smale
Of historial thyng that towchit gentelnesse
And also moralite and holinesse
Blame nowt me yif that yee cheze amys
Thes Mellere is a cherl yee knowe well that
So was thee Reue also and other moo
And harlottrie they toldēm bothe twoo
A vise yow and putte mee owt of blame
And also men schal nowt make ernest of game
¶ Here bee gynniht the tale
Whilum ther was dwellyngge in Oxenforde
A Riche gnvffe that gestis hadde to borde
And offe his craft hee was a carpenter
¶ Wtith hym ther was dwellyngge a povere skoler
Hee hadde lerned art but alle his fantesye
Was turned for to lerne astrologye
And hee cowde a certeyin of conchisionis
Forto demen by intorogacionis
Yif that men askede him in certeyn owris
Whanne that men scholde have drowghtte or schowris
Or yif men askede hym what schold be falle
Offe every thyng I ne may not Rekene hem all
¶ This clerk was cleped hende Nicholas
Of derne loue hee cowthe and of prevy solas
And therto hee was sleygh and preve
And lyike a Mayden meke forto see
A chawmber hadde hee in that hostelrie
Allone wtith owten any manere cvmpanye
Full fetyislye dyght wtith Erbis sote
And hee hym self as swete as is the rote
Of licoryis ore of any setewale
His almageste and bokis greete and smale
His asterlabore longgynge fore his art
His awgrym stonis layen full feyire apart
On schelvis kowched at his beddis heed
His presse covered wtith a faldyngge Reed
¶ And alle a bove theer lay a gay sawtrie
On whiche hee made a nyghttis meladye
So swetelye that all thee chawmber rong /
And Angelus ad virginem hee song
And after that hee sang the kyngis note
Well offten blessyd was his merie throte
And thus this swete clerk his tyme spentte
After his frendis fyndyngge and his rentte
¶ This Carpenter hadde wedded newe a wyif
Wiche that hee louede more thanne his lyif
Offe xviij yere schee was of age
Ielous hee was and heeld here narwe in cage
For schee was wyilde ⁊ yong ⁊ hee was oolde
And demede hym self to bee a cokolde
Hee knew nowt catovn for his wit was Rewde
That bad men wedde here symellitude
That bad men scholde wedde after his estate
For yowthe and Eelde been ofte at debate
But syhtthe hee was fallen in the snare
Hee moste endure as other folkis hadde don are
¶ Fayir was this yong wyif ⁊ ther wtith alle
As any whesele here body was gentell ⁊ smalle
A seynt schee werede I barred all of selk
A barm klooht as whit as any melk
Vppon here lenddis full of manye a gore
Whit was here smok ⁊ browded all be fore
And eke be hynde on here coler a bowte
Of kole blac selk wtith inne and eke wtith owtte
Thee tapis of here white volipeer
Were of the same sewt offe here coler
Here felet brood of selk and sette ful heye
And sekerlye sche hadde a licorows Eeye
¶ Well smale pulled were here browis two
And tho were bent as blac as any slo
Sche was full more blisfull onne to see
Thanne is the newe pere ionette tree
And softtere thane is the wolle offe awether
And by here gyrdill heng apurs of lethr
Tasselid wtith grene and perled wtith latown
In all this world to seken vp ānd down
Ther is no man so wyis that cowde thenche
Soo gay apopilote ore swiche a wenche
Full bryghttere was the schinynge of here hew
Thanne in the towr thee noble forged so newe
But of hore song it was as lowde ⁊ yerne
As any swalwe syttingge on aberne
¶ Therto sche cowde skppe and make game
As any kede ore calf folwyngge his dame
Here mowht was swete as brakot or meeht
Ore odure of applus leyid in hey ore heeht
Winsyngge schee was as is a ioly colt
Long as amast vpryght as a bolt
¶ A broche schee baare vppon here loue coler
As brood as was thee boos of a bokeler
Here schois were lacid on here leggis heye
¶ Sche was a premerole a piggis neye
For eny lord to lyggen in his bedde
Ore yit for eny good yoman forto wedde
¶ Now sire and eft efte sire so befell the caas
That on aday this hende Nicholas
Fell wtith this yonge wyif to rage and to play
While that here hosebonde was at Oosenay
As clerkis beene full sotill ⁊ full queyntte
And previlye hee cawte here bee the queyntte
And seyde I wis but yif I have my wille
For derne loue of thee lemman I spille
And heelde here harde by thee havnche bonis
And seyde leman loue mee all attonis
Ore I will deye also god mee save
And schee sproung as dooht a colt in a trave
And wtith here heed schee wride faste awey
Schee seyde I will not kysse thee be my fey
Why lat bee qd sche ich late be Nicholas
Ore I wille crye owt harrowe and allas
¶ Doo a wey yowre handis fore yowre curtesye
This nicholas gan Mercy forto Crye
And spake so feyre and ꝓproferede here soo faste
That schee here loue hym sche granted ate the laste
And swor here ooht bee seynt Thomas of kent
That schee wolde beene atte his comowndement
Whanne that schee may here leyser well asspie
For min housebonde is so full of ielowzye
And but yif yee wayte weell ⁊ been preve
I wot Ryght well I ne am but deed qd sche
Thow moste bene full deerne as in this caas
Nay theere offe thar thee nowt drede qd Nicholas
A clerk hadde letherlye bee sette his while
But yif hee cowthed a Carpenter bee gyle
And thus they a cordede and soo bee they sworne
To wayten a tym as I have tolde be forne
¶ Whanne Nicholas hadde doon thus every adeell
And thacked here abowten thee lendis weell
Hee kyssiht here swete and takyht his sawtrie
And pleyeht faste and makyht melodye
¶ Thanne fell hit thus that to the parissche cherche
Cristis owne werkis forto werche
This good wyif wentte vppon an haliday
Here fore heed schon as bryght as any day
Soo was it wachsschen whanne sche lefte here werk
¶ Now was ther of that cherche a pariche clerk
Thee wyche that kleped was Absolon
Crvlle was his heer and as thee golde it schon
And strowtede as a fanne large ⁊ brode
Ful streyght and evene lay thee ioly schode
His Rode was Reed his Eeyen graye as goos
Wtith powlis wyndowis corven were his schois
In hosyn Rede hee wentte fetyisly
I cladde hee was full small and proꝑperly
In a kyrtill of a lyght wagette
Full feyre and thicke been thee poynttis sette
And theere vppon hee hadde a gay swrplis
As wyght as was thee blosme on thee Ryis
¶ A Merie chyild hee was so god mee save
Weell cowde hee lete blood klippe and schaue
Ore Make a chartre of lond ore a quitawnce
In xxtiri Maneris cowde hee trippe or dawnce
After thee skole offe Oxenforde thoo
And wtith his leggis casten two and froo
And pleyen songgis on a smal Ribibe
And svm tyme hee songe alowd quinible
And as well cowde hee pleye on a geterne
In all that town nas brewhows no taverne
That hee ne visytede whit his solas
Theere as any gaylard tr was
But sooht forto seye hee was svmdell skoymes
Of fartyngge ore of speche dawngerus
¶ This Absolon that was ioly and gay
Gooht wtith asencer oune thee soneday
Senssyngge thee wyvis offe thee ꝑperische faste
And manye alovely loke on hem hee caste
And namelye on this Carpenteris wyif
To loken on here hym thowghtte it a merie lyif
Schee was so proꝑpere and swete and licorows
¶ I daar weell seyen yif sche hadde been a mows
And hee a catte hee wolde here hentte annon
This parychs clerk this ioly absolon
Hath in his hertte swiche aloue longgynge
That of no wyif toke hee noon offryngge
For cvrtesye hee seyde that he ne wolde noon
¶ Whānne it was nyght full bryght the mone schon
And absolon his geterne hadde take
For paramouris hee thowehte forto wake
And foorht hee gooht ioyfull and amerovs
Tille hee come to thee Carpenteris hows
A lytell after thee kockis hadde I crowe
And dreste hym vp vnder a schote wyndowe
That was vppon thee Carpenteris wall
And hee synggyht in his voyis genttell ⁊ small
¶ Now dere lady yif thy wille it bee
I praye yow that yee wille thencke on mee
Full weell a cordawnt to his geternyngge
This Carpenter Awook and herde hym syngge
And spake to his wyif and seyde Annon
What Alisovn herest nowt thow Absolon
That chavntyht thus vnder owre bowris wall
And sche ansswerde here hosebonde wtith alle
Yis god woot Iohn I here it everidell
This passeht foorht what will yee betir than well
Fro day to day this ioly absolon
¶ Goo wowyht here that hym is woo bee goon
Hee wakyht all thee nyght and all thee day
Hee kembyht his lockis brode ⁊ makyht hym gay
Hee wowyht here by menis and brocage
And swor hee wolde bee here owne page
Hee synggyht brockyngge as A Nyghttinghale
Hee sentte here pyment meeht ⁊ spised ale
And wafris pipingge hoot owt of the gleed
And for schee was of town hee ꝓprofered here mede
For some mēm will beye womēm for Richesse
And some for strokis ⁊ some for gentelnesse
Svmtyme to schewe his lyghtnesse ⁊ Maystrie
Hee bleyiht herawdis on a scaffold full heye
¶ But what a vayliht hym as in this caas
Soo louede sche hendy Nicholas
That absolon may blowe thee bovkkis horn
Hee ne hadde for his labour but a skorn
And thus sche makyht absolon here Ape
And all his ernest is turned to a iape
Full sooht is this ꝓproverbe it is no lye
Men seyne Ryght thus alwey thee neye slye
Make thee feer leef to bee loht
For thowgh Absolon bee wood or wrooht
By cavze that hee was fer fro here syght
This neyhg Nicholas stode in his lyght
¶ Now bere thee well thow hende Nicholas
For Absolon may weyle ⁊ syngge allas
And so it be fell vppon a sater day
This Carpenter was gon to Osenay
And hende Nicholas and Alisovn
A corded been to this conclusioun
That Nicholas schall schapen hym awyle
This sely gelous husbonde to be gyle
And yif so be thee game wente aright
Schee scholde slepe in his armis all nyght
For this was his dessire and hers also
¶ And Ryght anon wtith owten wordis mo
This Nicholas wolde no lengere tarie
But dooht full softe vnto his chawmber carie
Bothe mete and drynke for aday or tweye
And to here hosebonde bad here seye
Yif that hee askede after Nicholas
Schee scholde seye schee nyste where hee was
Of all that day sche sawe hym not wtith eeye
Schee trowede that hee hadde svm maledye
For no cri here mayde cowde hym calle
Hee nolde ansswere for thyng that myghtte
¶ This passyht foorht all thilke saterday
That Nicholas still in his chawmber lay
And eete and slepte or dede what hym leste
Till on soneday that the svnne gooht to Rest
This sely carpenter hath greet Marvayle
¶ Of Nicholas or what thyng scholde hym Eeyle
And seyde I am a drad by seynt Thomas
Hit stondiht nowght a Ryght wtith Nicholas
God schyilde that hee deyde soudeyinly
This worlde is now full tikil sikirly
I sawe to day a Corpis bore to cherche
That now a Moneday last I saw hym werche
Goo vp qd hee vnto his knave A noon
Klepe atte his dore ore knocke wtith a stoon
Loke how it is and telle mee boldely
This knave gooht hym vp full sturdyly
¶ And atte chawmber dore while that hee stood
Hee cride and knockede as hee were wood
What how what do yee Mayster Nicholay
How may yee slepe alle thes longe day
But alle for nowghg hee herde nowt aword
An hole hee foond full lowe vppon a boord
Theer as thee cat was wont in forto crepe
And atte that hole hee lokede in full depe
And atte laste hee hadde of hym a syght
¶ This Nicholas sat gapyngge evere vp Ryght
As hee hadde loked on thee newe Mone
A down hee gooht and tolde his mayster sone
In what array hee saw this ilke man
This carpenter to blesce hym hee be gan
And seyde help vs seyint frideswyde
A man wot lytell what hym schall betyde
This man is fallen wtith his Astronemye
In svm woodnesse ore in svm Agonye
I thowghtte alwey well how it wolde bee
Men scholde nowt knowe of goddis piriuite
Yee blessid bee alwey a lewid man
That nowght but onlye his bee leve can
¶ So ferde annother clerk wtith astronemye
Hee walkede into thee feeldis fore to prie
Vppon thee sterris what theer schall be falle
Tille hee was in A Marell pitte I falle
Hee cawe nowt that but yit bee seynt Thomas
Mee Rewyht sore for hendy Nicholas
¶ Hee schall bee aratid of this studiynge
Yif that I may bee Ihesu heuene kynge
Gete mee a staf that I may vnderspore
While that thow Robyn hevist vp thee dore
Hee schall owt of his studyinge as I gesse
And to thee chawmber dore hee gan hym dresse
His knave was a strong carl fore the nonis
And by thee haspe hee hentte vp the dore attonis
And in to thee flore hee threwe it down anon
And ay sat this Nicholas as stille as any ston
¶ And evere gapide vpward into thee Eeyr
This Carpenter wende hee were in desspeyr
And hentte hym by the schuldris myghttily
And schoke hym harde and cride spetusly
What Nicholay what hoow what loke a down
Awake and thynk on cristis passiovn
I crowche thee from elvis ⁊ fro wickide wyghttis
There wtith thee nyght spell hee seyde anoon Ryghttis
On fowre haluis of thee hows a bowte
And on the threscholde on the dore wtith owte
¶ Ihu Crist and seynt Benedict
Blesse this hows fram everi wicked wyght
For nyghttis verie the white pater noster
Where woneste thow now seynt petris sustir
And atte thee laste this hendy Nicholas
Gan forto syke sore and seyde allas
Schall all this worlde be lost eft sonis now
This Carpenter ansswerde what seyist thow
What thenk on god as wee done mēm that swinke
This Nicholas ansswerde fecche me drincke
And aftir wille I speke in previtee
Of certeyn thyng that towchit thee ⁊ mee
I will tell it non other man certeyn
¶ This Carpenter gooht dovn ⁊ comyht a geyn
And browghtte of myghtty ale a large quart
And wānne eche of hem hadde drvncken his part
This Nicholas his doris faste hee shette
And the carpeter a down by hym hee sette
Hee seyde Iohn myin hoste leef and dere
¶ Thow schalt vppon thy trowthe swere to me here
That to no wyght thow schalt this cunsseyil wreye
Fore it is cristis cvnsseyill that I seye
And yif thow tell any wyght thow art man forlore
And this veniawnce schalt thow haue therfore
That yif thow wreye mee thow schalt be wood
Nay crist it mee forbede fore his holy blood
¶ Quot thoo this Sely man I nam no labbe
And thowgh I seye it I am nowt leef to gabbe
Seye what thow wolt I schall it nevere telle
To chyild no to wyif by hym that heried helle
Now Iohn quod Nicholas I wille nowt lye
I have I fownde in myin Astrologie
As I haue loked in thee Mone bryght
¶ That now on Moneday next at quarter nyght

IN feyht squier thow hast thee well qiut
And gentelly I preyse well thy wit
Quod the Marchant consideringe thy yowthe
So felyngly thow spekest sire I a lowe the
As to my dome theer is noon that is heere

I hadde leuere thanne xxtiri powndis worht londe

¶ But yif a man bee vertews wtith all

¶ Strawe for yowre genttelnese qd owre Ooste
What Marchavnt ꝑperde syre weell thow woste
¶ That eche of yow moote tellen atte thee leeste
A tale ore two ore breken yowre bee heste

I preye yow to have mee in no desdeyn
Thowgh I to this man speke aword ore twoo
Telle on thy tale wtith owten wordis moo
Gladlye sire Ooste quod hee I wille obeye
Vnto yowre will herkenyht what I seye
I wille yow nowght contrarie in no wyse
As ferre as my wittis wille svffise
I praye to god that it may plese yow

¶ Here be gynnyht the Marchuntis

A worthy knyght that born was in pavie

And sixty yeere a wyifles man was hee
And folewed ay hys bodily delyte
On wōmman theere as was his apetyte
As done this folis that be seculeris

¶ I can nowt seye but swiche a greet corage
Hadde this knyght to been a wedded man

Preyinge owre lord to grawnte hym that hee
Myghtte onys knowe that blisful lyif
That is bee twixe an housbande ⁊ his wyif
And forto lyve vnder that holy band
Thee whiche god ferst blessede wtith his owne hand
Noon other lyif seyde hee is worht a bene
Fore wedloc is so Eesy and so klene

¶ Thus seyde this Oolde knyght that was soo wyis
And certeinlye as sooht as god is kyng

¶ Thanne is a wyif thee frwte of his tresore

Where as thyȝe bacheleris synggen allas
Whanne as they fyinden any advercitee
In love whiche that is but chyildes vanitee
And trewly it sitte Ryght weel to bee soo
That bacheleris have often peyne ⁊ woo
¶ On broutel grownde they byelde broutelnesce

In lyberte and vnder nyce a Reeste

Lyviht his lyif ful blisfully and ordinate

¶ Wel is his herte in Ioye and blisse that stownde
For who can bee so buxvm as a wyif

Fore in wele and in woo schee wille hym nevꝰer for sake

Of thee whiche Theofraste is oon of thoo
¶ What foors thowgh theofraste lystiht forto lye
Takyht no wyif qd hee fore . it is . hosebandrye
As forto spare in howshold offe thy desspence

For schee wille clayme half / parte alle here lyif

Wolle kepe thee bettere thanne sche that wayteht ay
After thy good and hat done manye aday
And yif thow take a wyif that to thee is vntrewe
Ful often tymes hit schal thee grew ⁊ Rewe
¶ Thyȝe ententtis and an hvndred tymes wersse
Wryteht this man that god his bonys cvrsse

¶ Deffye Theofras and herkeyht to mee
A wyif is goddis yifte verraily

Ore othere meblis al been yiftis of fortevne
That passen as a schadwe on a wal
But drede it nowght playnlye speke I shal
A wyif wole laste and in thyin hows endeure
Wel lengere thanne thee luste ꝑperaventture
¶ Mariage is a thyng a ful greet sakrement
Hee that hath no wyif I telle hym but schent

And herkeneht why I seye it nowt al for nowght
Thee wōmman is for mannys help I wrovght

And sawe hym lygge a lone al bely naked
¶ God of his greet goodnesse seyde thanne

Here may yee see and herby may yee preve
That a wyif is Mannis moste cvmfort
His ꝑperadyis his ioye and his mooste de sport

Oon fleehs they beene and twoo sowlis I gesse

¶ A wyif a seyntte Marie and Benedicite
How myghtte a man thanne have any advercite

Thee blisse of hevene is bee twixe hem tway
Theer may no tvnge tellen or herte thencke
Yif hee bee pore schee helpyht hym to swinke

Schee seyht nowt ones nay whanne he seyht yee
Doo this seyht hee al a redy sire seyht schee

Thow art so merie and eke so vertuous
And soo comendable and soo apprevid eke
¶ That every man that halt hym worht a leke
Vppon his bare knees awghtte al his lyif

And othere preye god hem forto sende

Loo Abigayl by here cvnsseyl how that schee

¶ Suffre thy wyvis tvngge as Catoūn bit
Schee schal comownde ⁊ thow schalt suffre hit
And yit schee wille obeye of curtesye

Theere as there is no wyif thee hows forto kepe

And fore his freendis on aday hee sentte

Wtith face sad this tale hee hath hem toolde
And hee seyde frendis I am bothe hore ⁊ Oolde

Vppon my sowle svmwhat moste I thynke

Vnto svm Mayde yong and tendre of age

¶ But oo thyng warne I yow my frendis dere

Oold fyche ⁊ yong fleche that wolde I have certayn
Bettꝰer is qd hee apike thanne is a pikerel
And better thanne oolde beef is thee yonge veel
I wil no wōmman of thritty wynter of agee
Hit ne is but bene straw ⁊ greet forage
And yif this oolde wyvis god it woot
They cvnne soo moche craft on wadis boot

¶ But certis a yong thyng may men gye

¶ By god theer is no man in al this town
Nee in Itayle cowthe better have seyd
Crist holdyht hym of this ful wel a payd
And trewely it is an heygh corage
Of any man that stopyn is in agee
To taken a yong wyif bee my fader ken
Yowre hertte hangyht vppon a Ioly pyn
Doht now in this matere ryght as yow lyste
Fore finally I hoolde it fore thee beste
¶ Iustinus that ay stil satt and herde
Ryght in this wyse to placebo hee ansswerde
Now brother myin bee pacient I yow praye
Sythenis that yee have sayd herkene what I saye
Senek amongis other wordis wysee
Seyht that a man awghtte hym wel avise
To whom hee yevyht his lond or his catel
And sythenis I awghtte to avyse mee ryght wel
To whom I yaf my body for al wey
¶ I warne yow wel it is noo chyildis pley
To taken a wyif wtith owten avisement
Men mosten en quere this is myin assent
Wheyther schee bee wyis sobre or drvnkelewe
Owther prowd ore otherwyse a schrewe
A chydesstere other a wastere of thy good
Other Riche or pore or ellis a man is wood
Al bee it so that no man fyinde ne schal
¶ Noone in this world that trottyht hool in al
Hit is mene inowhg the beste men can devise
¶ But natheles it awghtte I nowgh suffice
Wtith any wyif yif so were that schee hadde
Moo of goode thewis thanne here vicis badde
And al this askyht leyser to en quere
Fore god woot I have wepte manye a tere
Ful previly sythyins I hadde a wyif
Preyse who so wole a wedded mannys lyif
¶ Certayn I fyinde in hit but greet cost ⁊ care
And observauncis offe al blissis ful bare
And yit god thanks my neygheboris a bowte
And namelye of wōmmen a greet rowte
Seyn that I haue thee most stedefast wyif
And thee mekest oone that beryht lyif
But I woote best where wringeth my schoo
Yee may for me Ryght as yow lust doo
A vise yow yee been a man offe agee
How that yee entre in to Mariage
And namelye wtith a yonge wyif and a fayre
¶ By hym that made water Eerthe ⁊ Ayre
Thee yongeste man that is in al this rowte
Is besy mowgh to bryngge hit abowte
To have his wyif allone trustyht mee
Yee schulle nowght plesen here yeris three
This is to seyine to done here plesavnce
A wyif askyht ful manye an observaunce
¶ But I praye yow ne bee nowt evel a payid
Wel qd Ianuarie ⁊ hast thow al sayid
Straw for thy senek and fore thy proverbis
I a cownte hem nowt at a paniere ful of Eerbis
Of skole termys for wysere men thanne thow
As thow hast herd assentyht hit Ryght now
To my purpos placebo what sey yee
¶ I seye it is a cursed man quod hee
That lettyht Matrimonye sikerly
And wtith that word they risen sodeynly
And been assentyd fully that hee scholde
Bee wedded whanne hym lest ⁊ were hee wolde
This fatesie and this Couriousnesse
Fro day to day gan in thee sowle in presse
¶ Of Ianuare a bowte his mariage
Manye feyre schap and manye feyir visage
There passyht his herte nyght by nyght
As whos toke a myrowr polschid bryght
And sette it in a comvne Market place
Thanne scholde hee seen manye a figure pace
By his mirourer and in the same wyse
¶ Gan Ianuare wtith inne his thowght devise
Of Maydenis whiche that dwellyht be syde
Hee wiste nowt where that hee myghtte abyde
For though that oon haue bewte in here face
A nother stant so in thee peples grace
For here sadnesse and here benignite
¶ That of thee peple grettest voyis hadde sche
And some were riche and hadden badde name
But natheles betwixe ernest and game
And atte thee laste enpoyntede hym īn oone
And leete al othere fram his herte goone
And chees here of his owne avtoritee
For loue is blyind alday and may not see
¶ Whanne hee was in his bedde I browght
Hee portreyde in his herte ⁊ in his thowght
Here freche beavte and here age tendre
Here middel smal here armes longe ⁊ sklendre
Here wyise governawnce and here gentelnesse
Here wōmmanly berynge and here sadnesse
¶ And whanne that hee froo here was condessendit
H thowghtte his choyis myghtte nat be mēmded
For that hee hym self concludede hadde
Hym thowghtte ilke other mānnis wit so badde
That in possible it were to replye
A yenst his choyis this was his fantesye
His freendis sentte hee to at his instaunce
And preyeht hem to done hym that plesaunce
That hastilye they wolde to hym come
Hee wol quite here laboure al ⁊ some
It nedyht no more to hem to gone or ryde
Hee was apoynted where hee wolde abyde
¶ Placebo come and his other freendis sone
And alther ferst hee bad hem al a bone
That none of hem none argumenttis make
Ayenst his purpos that hee hath take
Which purpos was plesant to god seyde hee
And verray grownd of his prossperitee
Hee seyde theer was a mayden in thee town
Whiche that of beavte hath greet renown
¶ Al were hit so schee were of smal degre
Suffisit hym here yowthe ⁊ here beavte
Which mayde hee wolde here hand to wyve
To leden in Eese ⁊ in holynesse his lyve
And thanked god that he myghtte have here al
That no wyght his blisse de parte schal
Hee preyeht hem to laboure in this nede
¶ And schapyht that hee fayle nowght to spede
For thanne hee seyde his spirite was atte eese
Thanne is qd hee no thyng that may mee dessese
Saue oo thyng prickyht in conscience
Thee whiche I wole reherce in yowre presence
¶ I have herd seye qd hee ful yore a goo
Theer may no man have ꝑperfyht blissis twoo
That is to seye in Eerthe and eeke in heuene
For they hee kepte hym froo thee sennis sevene
And eeke fore every bravnche of thilke tree
Yit is theere so ꝑperfyht prosperitee
And so greet eese and lust in mariage
That evere I am a gast now in myn age
¶ That I schal lede so merie a lyif here
Fore sitheins that verray hevene is bowght so dere
Wtith trebulacioūn and greet penawnce
How scholde I leue in swich plesavnce
As al wedded men doone wtith here wyvis
Comen to thee blisse theere crist eterne is
This is my drede and yee my bretherin tweye
Assoyleht mee this questioūn I yow preye
¶ Iustinus thee whiche that hatede his folye
Anssweryge Anoon Ryght in his iaperie
And fore hee wolde his long tale abregge
Hee wolde none avtoriteys legge
¶ But seyde sire so theer bee noone obstakele
Other thanne this god of his heye myrakle
And fore his mercy may so fore yow wirche
That ere yee haven yowre yiftis in holy cherche
Yee may may repentte of wedded mannis lyif
In whiche yee seyne theer neis nowther woo no stryf
And ellis god for bede but yif hee sentte
A wedded man grace hym to repentte
Wel often rathere thanne a sengel man
And theer fore syre thee beste Reed that I can
¶ Dispeyriht yow nowght haviht in memorie
ꝐPerawentur schee may bee yowre purgatorye
Schee may bee goddis mene and his whippe
Thane schal yowre sowle vp to heven skippe
Swiftere thane dooht an arwe owt of a bowe
¶ I hope to god here after schal yee knowe
That theer nis noon so greet filicite
In mariage ne nevere more schal bee
That yow schal lacke of yowre savacioūn
So that yee vse as skele is and resoun
Thee lustis of yowre wyif attemꝑperally
And that yee plese here nowt to Amerously
And that yee kepe yow also froo other synne
My tale is doon for my wit is chenne
Beeht nowt agast heer offe my brother
¶ But late vs wade fro this mater to Another
Thee wyif of bathe yif yee wille vnderstonde
Of mariage whiche yee heven an honde
Declaren can I ful weel in a litel space
Fareht wel god have yow in his grace
And wtith that word this Iustine and his brether
Haue take here leue ⁊ eche of hem at other
For whanne they sawe it moste nedis bee
They wrovghtten so by wit and by sleygh tretee
¶ That this mayde whiche that mayus heyghtte
As hastily as evere that sche it doon myghtte
Sal wedded bee vnto Ianuarie
I trowe hit were to longe yow to tarie
Yif I yow tolde of everi skrite or bande
By whiche that schee was feffid in his land
Owther forto herkene of hire riche array
But fynallye I comen is this day
¶ That to thee cherche bothe been they went
Fore to resseyue thee holy sakrement
Foorht comyht thee preest wtith stole abowte his necke
And bad here bee ilyke to sarra and rebecke
In wyisdom and trewthe of Mariage
And seyde his orisownis as was his vsage
And crowchede hem and bad god scholde hēm blesse
And made al seker I nowgh wtith holynesse
¶ Thus been they wedde wtith greet solempnyte
And at the feeste syttyht hee and schee
Wtith othere worthy folk vppon thee deyis
Al Ful of ioye and blisse is thee paleyis
And ful of instrementtis and of vetayle
Thee moste deynteis of alle ytayle
Bee forne hem of instrementis wtith swiche a sown
That orpheus ne of phebes ampheown
Ne made nevere swiche a melodye
And at every cours com lowde menstralcye
That nevere was Trvmpede forto here
Novther theomadas yit haluendell so klere
And thebes whanne thee Citee was in dowte
Bacus thee wyin schenchit al a bowte
And venus laweght on every wyght
For Ianuarye was by comen here knyght
And wolde bothe assayden his corage
In liberte and eke in Mariage
¶ And wtith here firy bronde in here hand abowte
Daunsyht by fore thee Bride alle a bowte
And cꝰertenlye dare I weel seyn of al this
Emyneus that god of weddynge is
Sawe nevere in his lyif so merie a wedded man
Halde thow thy pees thow poete Marcian
That writyst to vs that ilke weddyngge merie
¶ Of here phylogie and of here Mercurie
And of thee songis that thee Musonis song
To smale as eke thy penne ⁊ eke thy tonge
Forto deskriven offe this Mariage
Whanne tendre yowthe hath wedded stovpynge age
Theere is swich Merthe that it may not be write
Assayeht it yowre self and thanne may yee wyte
Yif that I lacke ore noon in this Matere
Mayus that sitt wtith so benygne a chere
Here to bee hoolde it semede fayrie
¶ Quene Ester lokede nevere wtith swiche an Eeye
On Assuer so meke aloke hath schee
I may yow nowt devise alle hiere bewtee
But thus moche of here abowten telle I may
That schee was lyike the bryght someris day
Fulfeld of beawte and plesavnsse
¶ This Ianuarie is Ravichsschid in a trawnce
And atte every tyme hee lokede in here face
But in his herte hee gan here to manace
Whane hee myghtte in armes hee wolde here strey
¶ Hardere thanne evere parys dede Eleyne
But natheles yit hadde hee greet pitee
That thilke nyght offende here moste hee
And thowghtte allas O tendre creature
Now wolde god yee myghtte wel endure
Al my corage hit is so scharp and kene
I am a gast yee schul it nowght sustene
But god forbede that I dede al my myght
Now wolde god that it were woxen nyght
And that the nyght wolde lasten evere mo
¶ I wolde this peple were al a goo
And finallye hee dooht alle his laboure
As hee best myghtte savingge his honowre
To hasten hem froo thee mete in sotel wyse
Thee tyme cam that resoun was to a rise
And after that men davncede and drynke faste
And spicis al a bowte thee hows they caste
And ful of ioye ⁊ blisse was every man
¶ Al but a squiere that heyghtte damyan
Whiche carf by fore thee knyght manye a day
Hee was so raveschid on his lady may
That fore thee verray payne hee was nere wood
Almost hee swelte ⁊ swounede theere hee stood
As that sche baar daunsynge in here hand
So freche sche was ⁊ therto so lykande
And to his bed hee wentte hym hastily
No more of hym at this tyme speke I
But there I lete hym wepe I nowgh ⁊ pleyne
Til freche May wille rewen on his peyne
¶ Oo ꝑperilous fuyer that in the bedstraw bredyht
Oo famvler foo that his servise bedyht
Oo servaunt traytou fals holy hewe
Lyke to thee Neddre sleygh ⁊ in bosum vn trewe
God schyilde vs alle froo yowre in equeyntaūnce
¶ Oo Ianuare drvnken in plesavnce
Of mariage see how thyine damyan
Thyine owne squiere and thyne borēm man
Hee entendyht to done thee velanye
God grawnte thee thyin harm to asspie
Fore in this worlde ne is worsee pestilence
Thanne homely foo alday in thy presence
ꝐPerformed hath this devine day his arke dyurne
No lengere may thee body of hym soiourne
Thee orysowte as in that latitude
Nyght wtith his mantel that is derk ⁊ rude
Gan forto sprede the myspreye a bowte
Fore whiche deꝑpertede is thes lusty Rowte
¶ For Ianuare wtith thank on every a syde
Hoome to here howsis lustily they ryde
There as they doon here thyngis as hem leste
And whane they sawe here tyme to go to reste
Sone after that this hasty Ianuare
Wolde goo to bedde hee wolde no lengere tarie
Hee drynkyht ipocras clarre and vernage
Of spicis hote to enkrece his corage
And manye a letewarie hadde hee ful fyin
Swich as the cursed Munk daun costantyn
Hath wreten in his booke offe coytu
To eten hem al hee ne was nothying eschew
¶ And thus to his prevy frendis seyde hee
For goddis loue as sone as it may bee
Lat voyde al this hows in curteys wise sone
Men drunken and drowen the tablis anone
The bride was browght to bedde as stil as stone
So hastede Ianuarie it moste bee done
And whanne the bed was wtith the preest blessed
Owt of the chawmber every man hēm dressed
And Ianuare hath faste in armes take
His frechs May his ꝑperadis his make
¶ Hee lullyht here hee kessyht here ful ofte
Wtith thicke bristelis of his berd vn softe
Ilyke to the skyn of howid fychs scharp as brere
Fore hee was schaue al newe in his manere
Hee rubbede here vppon the tendre face
And seyde thus allas I mote trespace
To yow my spowȝe ⁊ yow gretly offende
Ore tyme come that I wole down dessende
¶ But natheles consideryht this quod hee
Theer nis no werkman what so evere he bee
That may bothe werche well ⁊ hastily
¶ This wolde bee doon at leyser ꝑperfihtly
Hit is no fors how longe that wee pleye
I trewe in wedlok coupled bee wee tweye
And blessed bee the yok that wee been inne
Fore in owre actis wee may do no synne
A man may do no synne wtith his wyif
Ne hurte hym self wtith his owne knyif
Now wee have leue to pleye vs bee the lawe
¶ Thus labouriht hee tille thee day gan dawe
And vpryght in his bedde syttyht hee
And thanne hee takyht a sop in fyin clarre
And after that hee sang ful loude ⁊ klere
And kessede his wyif ⁊ made wantoun chere
Hee was al coltychs and ful of ragerie
And ful of gyrgown as is a fleckid pie
Thee slachke kyn a bowte his necke schakyht
While hee song so chawnted hee ⁊ crakyht
But god woot what that may thowghtte in hertte
Whanne schee hym sawe syttingge vp īn his schertte
In his nyght cappe and wtith his necke lene
Schee preysiht nowght his pleyinge worht a bene
¶ Thanne seyde hee thus my restynge while to take
Now day is come I may noo lengere wake
And down hee leyde his hede ⁊ slepte til pꝰerme
And afterwardee whardis whane that he sawe tyme
Vp rysiht Ianuare but frechs may
Holtyht here chawnber vnto the ferthe day
As vsage is of wyvis fore thee beste
For every labovre svm tyme moot haue reste
Owther ellis longe may hee nowt endure
This is to seyen noo lyvis creature
Bee hit of fychs ore brid or beeste or man
¶ Now wil I speke offe woful damyan
That longyht for loue as yee schul here
Therfore I speke to hym in this manere
I seye tohym Oo sely damyan allas
Ansswere to this mavnde as in this caas
How shalt thow to thy lady frechs May
Tellyn thy woo wol alwey seye nay
Yif thow speke schee wolle thy woo by wreye
¶ God bee thyin help I can no better seye
This syke damyan in venus fyere
Soo brennyht that hee deyeht for dessyre
Fore whiche hee putte his lyif in aventure
No lengere myghtte hee in this wyze endure
But previly a pener gan hee borwe
And in a lettre wroote hee al his sorwe
In manere of a complaynt other a lay
Vnto this feyre and frechs lady May
And in a purs of selk it henge on his scherte
Hath it putte ⁊ leyde it on his hertte
¶ Thee Mone that at fulle was that ilke day
That Ianuare hath wedded that frechs May
In two of tavre was in thee cancre glyden
So longe hath sche in here chambre a byden
As custovm is vnto this noblis alle
A bryde schal nowght eeten in the halle
Tille dayis fowre or thre dayis at the leeste
Passed been thanne lete here goon to the feeste
¶ Thee feerthe day complete froo noon to noon
Whanne thee heye masse was alle doon
In halle sit this Ianuare and may
As frechs as is thee bright someris day
And soo bifel how that this good man
Remēmbryht hym vppon this damyan
And seyde seynt marie how may this bee
That damyan entendyht nowt to mee
¶ Is hee ay syike ore how may this bee tyde
His squieris whiche that stoden hym be syde
Excusyngge hym by cavze of his sykenesse
Whiche that lettede hym to done his besinesse
Noon other cavze myghtte maken hym care
That mee fore thynkyht qd this Ianuare
Hee is a gentel squiere bee my trowthe
Yif hee deyde it were harm and rowthe
Hee is soo wyis diskrete and sekree
As any man I knowe of his degree
And therto manly ⁊ eke servisable
And forto bee a thrifty man Ryght able
¶ But after mete as sone as evere I may
¶ I wole my self visite hym and eke May
To done hym al the cvmfort that I can
And fore that word hym blessede every man
That of his benete and of his gentelnesse
Hee wolde hym so cvmforte in his syiknesse
To his squiere fore it was a gentel dede
¶ Dame quod this Ianuare take good hede
That atte after mete yee wtith yowre wōmmen alle
Whanne yee haue bee in chambre owt of this halle
That alle yee goon to seene this damyan
Dooht hym disport fore hee is a gentel man
And tellyht hym that I wole hym visitee
Haue I no thyng but rested mee alyte
Now wtith that word hee gan to hym calle
¶ A squiere that was Marchal of his halle
And tolde hym certeyn thyngis what hee wolde
This frechs may hath streyght here wey holde
Wtith alle here wōmmen vnto this damyan
Down by his beddis syde schee sette than
Cvmfortyngge hym as sche goodly may
This damyan whanne that hee his tyme say
In sekret wyse his purs ⁊ eke his bille
In whiche that hee writen hadde his wille
Hath put in to here hond wtith owten more
Saue that hee sikede wonder sore
¶ And softly to here ryght thus seyde hee
Mercy and that yee descovereht nowt mee
Fore I am deed yif that this thyng bee kyd
This purs hath sche wtith inne here bussvm hid
And wentte here way yee gete no more for mee
But vnto Ianuare I come a gayn is schee
And on his beddis syde sche sette here softe
Hee takyht here ⁊ kyssyht here ful ofte
And leyde hym down to slepe and that anoon
¶ Sche feynede here as that schee moste goon
Theer as yee woot that every wyght moste nede
And whanne sche of this bille hath take hede
Sche rentte hit al to clowtis at thee laste
And in thee prevy softly sche it caste
Who studieht now but feyre frechs may
¶ And adown by Ianuare softe sche lay
That slepte tille the kowghe hym a wakede
Anoon hee preyde here to strepyn here al nakyd
Hee wolde of here have he seyde svm plesaunce
Hee seyde here klothis dede hym en cvmbrawnce
And sche obeyiht were here leef ore ellis looht
But lest that pꝰercious folk be wtith me wrooht
How that hee wrovghtte I daar it nowght telle
Wheyther that hee thowghtte on ꝑperadyis ore on helle
¶ But I lete hem worche in here wyse
Tille evensonge ryngge ⁊ thanne moste they rise
Were it by destenye owther by aventure
Were it by in fluence owther by nature
Owther in constillacioūn that īn swich estat
The heuene stood that tyme fortunat
Was forto putte abille offe venus werkys
For al thyng hat tyme so seyn this clerkis
To any woman fore to gete hire loue
¶ I can nowght seye but the greet god aboue
That knowht that noon acte is causeles
Hee deme of alle fore I wole holde my pees
But sooht is this how that this frechs May
Hath take swich in pressioun that day
On pitee offe this syke damyan
That froo here hertte sche ne drive it can
The remembraunce forto doon hym ese
¶ Certeyn thowghtte sche whom that this thyng desspese
I rekke nowght fore heere I hym en sure
To love hym best of any creature
Thowgh hee no more hadde thanne his scherte
Loo how pitee rennyht sone in gentel hertte
Here may yee see how excellent fraunchise
In wōmman is whanne they hem narwe avise
Some tirawnt theer is as there been many oon
That hath an hertte as hard as any stoon
Whiche wolde have leten hym sterve in the place
Wel rathere thanne have garanted hym that garace
And hem reioysed in here crewel pride
And Recched nowght to been an homycide
¶ This gentel May ful felled of al pytee
¶ Ryght so of hire hond a lettre made schee
In whiche schee grawntede hym of here vꝰerey garace
Theer lackede nowght oonlye but day ⁊ place
Where sche myghtte to his lust suffisee
Fore it schal be Ryght as hee wole devise
And whanne schee sawe here tyme vppon aday
To visyte this damyan gooth fayre May
And sotellye this lettre down schee threste
Vnder his pilwe Reed yif hym leste
¶ Sche takyht hym bee thee honde ⁊ hard hy twiste
Soo sekerly that no wyght hit wiste
And bad hym to be al hool ⁊ foorht sche wentte
To Ianuare whanne that hee fore here sentte
Vp a rysiht damyan on thee nexte morwe
Al passed was his syiknesse and his sorwe
Hee kembyht hym and prunyht and pykyht
And dooht alle that his lady lust and lykyht
¶ And eeke to Ianuare hee gooht as lowe
As evere dede a dogge fore thee bowe
And hee is so plesawnt to every man
For crafte is al who that hit can
That every wyght is fayn to teche hym good
And fullye in his ladyis grace hee stood
Thus lete I damyan a bowte his nede
And my tale foorht wole I procede
¶ Some clerkis holden that felycite
That stante in delyght and theere fore hee
This noble Ianuare wtith alle his myght
In Oonest wyse as longyht to a knyght
Schope hym to lyue ful de lyciously
His howsyngge his array al Oonestly
To his degree was maad as a kynges
Amonggys othere of his Ooneste thyngges
¶ Hee hadde a gardyn walled al wtith stoon
Soo fayre a gardyn woot I nowhere noon
Fore wtith owten dowte verrily I suppose
That hee that wroot thee Romawnce of the rose
¶ Nee couthe offe hit thee bewte bettere devise
Nee pryapus ne myghtte nowght suffise
Thowgh hee bee god of gardinys forto telle
¶ Thee bewte of thee Gardyn and of thee welle
That stood vnder a lavrere alwey grene
Ful often tyme kyng pluto and his quene
ꝐPerreserpina and alle here fayrie
Desporten hem and maken melodye
A bovten that welle ⁊ davnceden as mēm tolde
¶ This noble knyght this Ianuare the Oolde
Swich deyinte hath in hit to walken ⁊ to pleye
That he wille suffre no wyght to bere the keye
Saue he hym self for of the smale wyket
Hee baare alwey offe selver a kleket
Wtith the whiche whanne that hym luste vnschette
And whane that he wolde paye his wyif his dette
¶ In somer sesovn theder wolde hee goo
And May his wyif ⁊ no wyght but they twoo
And thyngis whiche were not doon in bedde
Ther in thee gardyn ꝑperformede hem ⁊ spedde
And in this wyse manye a merie day
Lyuede this Ianuare and this feyire frechs May
But worldly ioye may nowt alwey endure
To Ianuare ne to no worldly creature
¶ Oo sodeyn hap Oo thow fortune vn stable
I lyke to thee skorpiown variable
That flaterist wtith thyin heed whānne thow wilt sty
Thy tayl is deeht thorghw thyin en venemynge
Oo brutel ioye Oo swete poysoun queynte
Oo Mustyer that sotellye canst peynte
Thyne yiftis vnder thee hewe of stedefastnesse
That thow desseyvedest bothe more ⁊ lesse
¶ Why hast thow Ianuare thus desseyved
And haddest hym for schee ful freend Resseyvid
And now thow hast be rafte hym bothe his Eeyen
For sorwe of whiche hee dissyreht hee to deyen
Allas this noble Ianuare that is so free
A middes his lust and his prosperite
Is woxen blynde and alle sodeynly
His deeht theer fore desyriht hee vtterly
¶ And theer wtith alle thee fyire offe ielosye
Lest that his wyif sholde falle in svm folye
Soo brentte his hertte that hee wolde fayne
That svm man bothe here and hym hadde slayne
Fore nevere after his deeht ne in his lyif
Nee wolde hee that schee were loue nee wyif
But evere to lyue as a wedewe in klothis blake
Soole as thee Turtele dooht that hath lost here make
But at thee laste after a Monthe ore tweye
His sorwe gan swage thee sooht to seye
¶ For whanne hee wiste hit may noon other bee
Pacientlye hee toke his advercitee
Sauf wtith owten dewte may hee nowght for goon
That hee nas ielous evere more in oon
Whiche ielosye hit was soo owtrageus
That nowther in halle ne in noon other hows
Hee ne wold suffre here nowther forto ryde ne goo
No in noon other place nevere thee moo
But yif that hee hadde hond on here alwey
¶ For which ful often wepyht feyre frechs May
That loueht damyan soo Benyngly
That schee moste eyther deye sodeynly
Owther ellis schee most have hym atte here lyste
Sche awaytiht whanne here hertte wole breste
Vppon that other syde this fornseyd damyan
By comen is thee sorwfulleste man
That evere was for neyther nyght no day
Nee myghtte hee speke a word to frechs May
As to his purpos of no swich matere
But yif that Ianuare moste it here
That hadde hand on here evere moo
¶ But natheles by writynge to and froo
And prevy sygnis hee wiste what sche mentte
And schee knewe by his sygnys his ententte
Oo Ianuarie what myghtte it to thee avayle
Thow myghttist see as feer as schip may sayle
Fore as good is a blyinde disseyved bee
As to bee desseyved whanne a man may see
Loo arguys whiche that hadde an . C . Eeyen
For al that evere hee cowthe poure or pryen
¶ Yit was hee blent and god woot so ben moo
That wenen wystly that it is nowt soo
Passe over is an eese and seye nomore
¶ This frechs May of whiche I spake of before
In warm wexe hath enprentyd this klyket
That Ianuare baar of that smale wyket
By whiche vnto his gardyn ofte hee wentte
And damyan that knewe al here ententte
Thee klyket counterfetede privily
There ne is nomore to seye but hastily
Svm wonder by this kleket schal be tyde
Whiche yee schulle heere yif ye wil abyde
¶ Oo noble ovide sooht seyist thow god woot
What sleythe is hit thowgh it be long ⁊ hoot
That hee nel fyinde it owt in svm manere
By pyramus and Thysbe may men lere
Thowgh they were kept ful longe streyte overal
They been a cordit rownynge thorghw a wal
Ther is noon cowthe fyinde swiche a sleyghtte
¶ But now to purpos er that dayes Eyghtte
Were passed or thee Monnthe of Iuyl by felle
That Ianuarie hath cawght so greet awille
Thorghw eggynge of his wyif hym forto pleye
In his gardyn ⁊ no wyght but they tweye
That in a Morwe vnto his may seyde hee
Ryis vp my wyif my loue my lady free
The Turtelis voyis is here my dowue swete
Thee winter is goon wtith alle his Regnys wete
Come foorht now wtith thyin Eeyen columbyne
Now feyrere ben thy bristis thanne is wyne
¶ Thee gardyn is en klosed al a bowte
Come white spowze owt of dowte
Thow hast me wounded in myin hertte oo wyif
No spotte in the nas in alle thy lyif
Come foorht and late vs take owre disport
I chees thee for my wyif and my cvmfort
Swiche Oolde lewde wordis vsede hee
And thanne on damyan a sygne made schee
That hee schulde go by foren wtith his kleket
¶ This damyan hath opened thee wyket
¶ And in hee sterte and that in swich manere
That no wyght myghtte it see ne here
And stille hee sytte vnder a buchs a noon
This Ianuare as blyinde soo any stoon
Wtith Mayus in his hand ⁊ no wyght moo
In to this frechs gardyn been they goo
And clappede to the wyket sodeynly
¶ Now wyif quod hee here nys now but thow ⁊ I
That art thee creature that I best love
For by that lord that sytte vs al a bove
Mee hadde levere deyen vppon a knyif
Thanne thee to offende dere trewe wyif
Fore goddis sake thenke how I thee chees
Nowght for no coveytise dowtelees
But only fore thee loue I hadde to thee
And thowgh that I bee Oolde ⁊ may nowt see
¶ Be to mee trewe and I wil tel yow why
Certis three thynggis schal yee wyne therby
Ferst loue of crist ⁊ to yowre self honowre
And al myin eritage town and towre
I yeve it to yow mkyht it as sekyr as yow leste
This schall bee doon to morwe ore Svnne vp riste
So wistly god my sowle brynge in to blisse
¶ I preye yow on covenaunt that yee mee kysse
And thowgh that I bee gelous ne wyte me nowght
Yee been so depe enpreented in my thowght
That whanne that I considere yowre bewtee
And theere wtith al thee vn lycly eelde of mee
I may nowt certis thowgh I scholde deye
For bere to been owt of yowre cvmpanye
For verray loue this is wtith owten dowte
¶ Now kesse mee wyif ⁊ lete vs rome a bowte
This frechs May whanne schee thise wordis herde
Benygnely to Ianuare schee ansswerde
But ferst and forward schee by gan to wepe
¶ I haue quod schee a sowle forto kepe
As welle as yee and also myin honowr
And offe my wyifhode that ilke tendre flowr
The whiche that I have assured in yowre hand
Whanne thee preest to yow my body band
¶ Where fore I wole ansswere in this manere
Wtith the leve of yow my lord so dere
I preye to god that nevere dawe I that day
That I ne sterve as fowle as any wōmman may
Yif evere I doo vnto my kynne that schame
Owther ellis that I enpeyre soo my name
That I bee fals ⁊ yif I doo that lacke
Take strepe mee and putte mee in a sacke
And in thee nexte Reveuer doo mee drenche
I am a gentel wōmman fore I am no wenche
¶ Why speke yee thus but men been evere vntrewe
And wōmmen have Repreff of yow ay newe
Yee can noon other cvntenawnce as I leue
¶ But speke to vs as in vntrust ⁊ in Repreve
And wtith that word schee sawe where damyan
Sat in thee buchs and knele hee be gan
And wtith here fynger sygnys made schee
That damyan schulde klymbe vppon a tree
That charged was wtith frwt ⁊ vp hee wentte
For verraily hee knewe here ententte
And every signe that sche cowthe make
Wel bettere thanne Ianuare here owne make
¶ Fore in a lettre schee hadde toolde hym al
Of this mateer how hee werchen schal
And thus I late hym sitte in thee perys
And Ianuare and Mayus rownynge ful merye
Bryght was thee day and blew was the firmanēmt
¶ Phebus of Gold down hath his stremys sent
To gladen every a flowr wtith his warmnesse
Hee was that tyme in gemynys I gesse
But luytel fro his declinacioun
Offe Canser ore Iouys Exaltacioun
And soo it bee fel that in abryght morwe tyde
That in that gardyn on the ferthere syde
¶ Pluto that was kyng offe fayrie
And manye a lady in his cvmpanye
Folwynge his wyif thee quiene ꝑperserpina
Whiche that hee Ravesschde owt of
Whilis that schee gaderede flowris in a Mede
¶ In clavdian yee may thee storye rede
¶ How in his grisly cart hee here sette
This kyng of fayrie a down hym sette
Vppon a benche of turvis frechs and grene
And Ryght anoon seyde hee thus to his quiene
My wyif quod hee that may nowght be seyd nay
Thee Experience provyht hit every day
Thee tresovn whiche that woman dooht to man
Ten hvndreht thowsand wel tellyn I can
Notable of yowre vn trowthe and brutelnesse
¶ Oo Salamon Richest of alle Richesse
Ful feld of Sapience and of worldly glorie
Ful worthy been thyne wordis to Memorie
To every wyght that wit and resovn can
Thus preysiht hee yit thee bovnte of man
A mong a Thowsand men yit foond I oon
But of alle women fonde hee nevere noon
¶ Thus seyht this kyng that knowtith yowre wickednesse
And Ihesus filius Cirak as I gesse
Ne spekyht of yow but seldyn Reverence
A wylde fyier a Corumpte pestilence
Soo fal vppon yowre bodyis this ilke nyght
Ne see yee nawght this honorable knyght
By cause Allas that hee is blyind and Oolde
His owne man schal make hym kokewold
Loo where hee sitte thee lechour in thee tree
¶ Now wil I grawntte of myn hey magestee
Vnto this Oolde blyinde worthy knyght
That hee schal have a geyn his Eeye syght
Whanne that his wyif wolde doon hym a velanye
Thanne schal hee knowe al here harlotrye
Bothe in repreef of here and othere moo
Schee schal qd ꝓproserpyn and wole yee soo
¶ Now by my modris syres sowle I swere
That I schal gevēm here soficient ansswere
And al wōmmen after for yowre sake
That thowgh been in any gylt I take
Wtith face boolde they schal hem self Excuse
And bere hem down that wolde ham a cuse
For lacke of ansswere noone of hēm scholde deyen
Al hadde yee seye athyng wtith bothe yowre Eeyen
¶ Yit schollen wee soo visage it hardily
And wepe and swere and chyde subtelly
That yee schul been as lewed as here gees
What Reckyht mee offe yowre Auttoriteis
¶ I woot wel this Iewe this salamon
Fond of vs women foolis manye oon
But thowgh that hee ne fond no good woman
Theer hath fownde manye Annother man
Women ful trewe ful goode ful verteuos
Witnesse on hem that dwellen in cristis hows
Wtith Marterdom they provede here constance
¶ The Romaygne Iestis maken Remēmbraunce
Of manye a trewe a trewe wyif alsoo
But sire ne bee nowght wrooht al be it soo
Thowgh that hee seyde hee fond no good woman
I preye yow take thee sentence of the man
Hee mentte thus that in soverayn bovnte
Nys noone but god but neyther hee ne schee
Eey for verray god that ne is but oon
What make yee soo moche of salamon
Yif that hee made a Temple goddis hows
¶ What thowgh hee were Riche and glorious
Soo made hee a Temple of fals goddis
Whoo myghtte doo any thyng that more for beden is
Parde as feyire as hee his name inplastree
Hee was a lecchour And an ydolatree
And in his eelde hee verray god for sook
And yif god ne hadde as seyht thes book
I spared hym fore his fadris sake hee scholde
Have lost his Reygne sounere thānne hee wolde
I sette nowght offe al thee vylenye
That yee of women write nowt a butterflye
¶ I am a woman nedis mote I speke
Owther ellis swelte tille myin hertte breke
Fore sytheins hee seyde that wee be Iangeleris
As evere mote I browke bothe myn eeris
I schal nowt spare for no cvrtesye
To speke hym harm that wolde vs velenye
¶ Dame qd this pluto bee no lengere wrooht
I yeve it vp but sytheins I swoor myin ooht
That I wolde grawntyn hym his syghtte ageyn
My word schal stande that warne I the certeyn
I am a kyng it sit mee nowght to lye
And I quod schee a quein ⁊ am offe feyrie
Here ansswere schal schee have I vndertake
Late vs theer offe no moo wordis make
For sothe I wole no lengere yow contrarie
¶ Now late vs turne a gayin to Ianuarie
That in this gardyn wtith this feyre May
Synggyht wel meriere thanne the popeniay
Yow loue I best ⁊ schal and other noon
Soo longe a bowte thee Aleyis is hee goon
Tille hee was come ageyns thilke pirie
Where as this damyan sittyht ful Merie
On heygh a mong thee frechs leuis grene
¶ This frechs may that is so bryght ⁊ schene
Gan forto syke and seyde allas my syde
Now sire quod schee fore owght that may be tyde
I moste have of thee peris that I see
Or I moste deye soo sore longyht mee
To Eeten of thee smale peris grene
Help fore here loue that is of hevene quiene
¶ I tel yow wel a woman in my plyght
May have to frwt so greet an apetyght
That sche may deye but sche it haue
Allas quod hee that I ne hadde here a knave
That cowde klymbe allas allas quod hee
Fore I am blynd yee sire no fors quod schee
But wolde yee fowchesauf for goddis sake
¶ Thee pirie wtith inne yowre armes forto take
For wel I woot that yee mystruste mee
Thanne sholde I klymbe wel I now qd schee
So I my foot myghtte sette on yowre bac
sthe seyde hee in mee schal be no lac
ght I yow helpe wtith myin hertte blood
Hee stouped down ⁊ on his bac schee stood
Schee cawghtte here by a twiste ⁊ vp sche gooht
Ladyis I praye yow that yee bee nowt wroht
¶ I can nat thȝe I am but a rude man
And sodeyinly anoon this damyan
¶ Gan pullen vp thee smok ⁊ in hee throng
¶ And whanne that pluto sawe that greet wrong
To Ianuare hee gaf his syghtte ageyin
Ne was theer nevere man of thyng so fayin
But on his wyif his thowght was everemoo
Vp to thee tree hee keste his Eeyen two
And sawe that damyan his wyif hadde dressed
In swich manꝰere it may not been expressed
But yif I wolde speken vn curteysly
And vp hee yaf a Rorynge ⁊ a cry
As dooht thee moder whanne the chyld schal deye
¶ Owt help allas herrow gan hee crye
Oo stronge lady stowre what doost thow
And sche ansswerde sire what eylis yow
Have pacience and resoun in yowre myinde
I haue holpen yow on bothe yowre Eeyen blyinde
Vppon perel of my sowle I schal nowt lye
As mee was tawght to heele wtith yowre Eeye
Was nothyng bettere to make a man too see
Thanne to strugle wtith a man vppon a tree
God woot I dede hit in ful good ententte
Strongle quod hee ya algate in hit wentte
¶ God yeve yow bothe on schames deeht to deyen
Hee swivede thee I sawe it wtith bothe myne Eeyen
And ellis bee I hanged by thee hals
Thanne is quod schee thee medicyne fals
For certeynlye yif that yee myghtte see
Yee wolde nowt seye thoo wordis vnto mee
Yee haue svm glimsynge ⁊ no ꝑperfit syghtte
I see qd hee as weel as evere I myghtte
Thanked bee god wtith bothe myne seyen twoo
And by my trowthe mee thowghtte he dede soo
¶ Yee maze maze goode sire quod schee
This thank have I fore I have maad yow to see
Allas qd schee that evere I was soo kynde
Now dame qd hee late al passe owt of mynde
Come down my leef ⁊ yif I have mys sayd
God helpe mee soo as I am evele a payd
¶ But bee my fadres sowle I wende I hadde seyn
How that this damyan hadde by thee leyn
¶ And that thy smok hadde leyn vppon thy brest
Yee sire qd schee yee may wene as yow lest
But sire a man that wakyht owt of his sleep
Hee may nowt sodeynlye weel take keep
Vppon a thyng ne seene hit parfyitly
Tille that hee be dawid verrily
Ryght soo a man that longe hath blyind I bee
Ne may nowt sodeyinlye soo weel I see
¶ Ferst whanne thee syghtte is newe come ageyn
As hee that hath a day ore two I seyn
Til that yowre syghtte stabelid bee a while
Theer may ful manye a syghtte yow be gyle
Beeht war I preye yow for bee hevene kyng
Ful manye man wenyht forto seen a thyng
And it is al annother thanne it semyht
Hee that mys consseyvyht mys demyht
And wtith that word sche leep down froo the tree
¶ This Ianuare whoo is glad but hee
Hee kessyht here ⁊ klyppiht here ful offte
And on here wombe hee strokyht here ful softe
And to his paleys hom hee hath here lad
Now goode men I preye yow to bee glad
Thus endyht here my tale of Ianuarie
God blesse vs ⁊ his moder seynt Marie

¶ Here be gynniht the Wyif of bathe ꝓprologge
Experience thowgh noon Autoritee
Were in this worlde is Right I nowgh for mee
To speke of woo that is in Mariage
For lordyngis seyn that I was xij winter of age
Thanked bee god that is eterne on lyue
Howsbandis atte Cherche dore I have had five
Yif I so often myghtte have wedded bee
But alle were worthy men in here degree
¶ But mee was toolde nowt longe A goon it is
That Syhtthe Crist ne wentte never but onis
Too weddyngge in the Cane of Galile
That be that ilke ensaumple tawghtte hee mee
That I ne scholde wedded bee but onis
But herke which a scharp word fore the nonys
By syde a Wel Ihu that was bothe god ⁊ man
Spak in repref of thee Samaritan
Thow hast had v hosebondis quod hee
And that man that now hath wedded thee
¶ Is nowght thy hosebonde thus seyde hee certeyn
What hee mentte therby can I nowght seyn
Wel but that I aske Was thee ferste man
Was noon husbonde to the Samaritan
How manye myghtte sche have in Mariage
Yit herde I never telle in myin olde Agee
Vppon this novmbre and difinicioun
Men may devine and glose vp and down
¶ But weel I woot expresse wtith owten lye
God bad vs forto wexe and Multiplye
That gentel texte can I wel vnderstonde
Also wel I wot hee seyde myin husbonde
Scholde lete fader and moder and take to mee
But of noon nvmbre Mencioūn made hee
Of bygamye ore offe octogamye
Why scholde men thenne of hit make velanye
¶ Loke here the wyise man kyng Salamon
¶ I trowe hee hadde wyvis moo thanne oon
Now wolde god it leefful were to mee
To been refrechssched half so ofte as hee
Which yifte of god hadde hee for al his wyvis
¶ Noo man hath swich that in this world alyue is
God woot this noble kyng as to my witte
The fyrste nyght hadde manye a merie fitte
Wtith eche of hem so wel was hym on lyue
Blessed bee god that I have wedded fyue
Welcome thee syxte whanne evere he schal
For sothe I wil nowt kepe mee chaste in al
Whanne myin husbonde is fro thee worlde I goon
Som cristen man schal wedde mee Anoon
For thanne the Apostel seyht that I am free
Too wedde on goddis half where it lykiht mee
¶ Hee seyde that to been wedded it is no senne
Better is it to been wedden thanne to brenne
What reckyht mee thowgh folk seye velonye
Offe schrewed Lameeht and his bygamye
¶ Weel I woot that Abraham was an holy man
A iacob Eeke as feer as evere I can
And eche of hem hadde wyvis moo thanne twoo
And manye an holy man
Where can yee seye in any maner age
That god deffendede vs mariage
By expresse word I preye yow tellyht mee
Or where that god comavndede virginite
¶ I woot as weel as yee it is noo drede
Thee apostel whanne hee spekyht of Maydenhede
Hee seyde theer of presepte hadde hee noone
But mēm may cvnseyle a woman to be oone
But cvnseyillyngge is noon comavndement
Hee putte hit in owre owne Iuggement
¶ For hadde god comavnded Maydenhede
Thanne hadde hee dampned weddyngge wtith the dede
And certis yif theer were no seed I sowe
Virginite wheer offe scholde it growe
¶ Poule durste nowt comawnden atte the leeste
A thyng the whiche his Mayster yaf hy noōm heeste
Thee dartte is sette vp for virgintee
Cacche who so may who rennyht best lat see
But this word is nowt take of every wyght
But there as god wolde yeve it of his myght
¶ I woot weel that the postel was a Mayde
But natheles thowgh that hee wroot or seyde
Hee wolde every wyght were swich as hee
Al nys nowt but cvnseyl to virginitee
And for to bee a wyif hee gaf me leue
Of in dulgence so is it no Repreve
¶ To wedde mee yif that my make deye
Whit owten excepcioun of bygamye
¶ Al were it good a woman forto towche
Hee mentte as his body or in his cowche
For ꝑperel is bothe in fyir and tow to assemble
Yee knowe what this ensample may ressemble
¶ This is al and svm hee heelde virginite
More ꝑperfyit thanne to be wedded in frelte
Freelte clepyd I nowt but that hee and schee
Wole lede hiere lyif al in chastite
¶ I gravnte it weel I have noon envie
Thowgh Maydenheed prefferre bygamye
Ȝit lykyht hem to bee klene in bodye ⁊ in gost
Of myn estate I wole make no boost
For wel yee knowe A lord in his howshold
Hath not every vessel maad of klene goold
Some been of tree and doon here lord servise
¶ God klepyht folk to hym in sundry wyse
And everich hath of god A ꝓpropre yefte
Some this some that as hym lykiht to schifte
Virginite is of a greet perfeccioun
And continent concience wtith devocioun
¶ But Crist that of perfeccioun is welle
Bad nowt every wyght that scholde selle
Al that hee hadde and yeve it to the poore
And in swich wyse folwe hym in his loore
Hee spake to hem that wolde lyue ꝑperfyitly
And lordyngis bee yowre leue that am nowt I
I wole be stowe the flowr of al my age
¶ In charite and frewt of Mariage
Telle mee also to what conclusyoun
Were the membris I maad of Generacioun
And of so ꝑperfight wyse and why I wrovght
¶ Tristyht ryght wel they were not mad for nowght
Glose whoo so wole and seye vp and down
That they were maad for purgacioun
Of vreyne and owre bothe thyngis smale
Were eeke to knowe A female froōm A Male
And fore noon other cavse what seye yee noo
Thyin exprience woot it is nowt soo
¶ Soo that this Clerkys bee not wtith mee wrooht
I seye this that they maked for bothe
¶ This is forto seyn for office and for eese
Of engendrynge dar wee nowt god disspese
Why scholde men ellys in here bokis sette
¶ That man schal yeelde to his wyif his dette
Now wher wtith schulde hee paye his payment
Yif that hee vsede nowt his sely insterment
Thanne were they maad vppon a Creature
Too purge vrryne and eke for engendrure
But I seye not that every wyght is holde
That hath swich harneys as I yow offe toolde
Too goon and vsen hem in engendrure
¶ Thanne schulde men take of chastite no cure
Crist was a Mayden and schapen as a man
And manye a seynt seyn the worlde by gan
Yit leuede they evere in ꝑperfyght chastite
But I wil nowt envie wtith no virginite
Lete hem eete breed of pured whete seed
And lete vs wyvis eete barly breed
And yit wtith barly breed Mark tel can
Owre lord Ihūn Crist frechssede manye a man
In swich estate that god hath kleped vs
¶ I wole ꝑperseuere I am nowght precious
In wyifhode wole I vse myin insterment
As frelye as my makere hath it mee I sent
Yif I bee davngerus god yeue mee sorwe
¶ Myin hosebonde schal it haue bothe even ⁊ morwe
Whanne that hym liste cvm paye his dette
An hosebonde I wil have I wille nowt lette
Which schal bee bothe my dettour ⁊ my thral
And to have his tribulacioun here wtith al
¶ Vppon his flechs while that I am his wyif
I have the powere durynge al my lyif
Vppon his propre body but nowght hee
Ryght thus the apostil tolde it vnto mee
Hee bad owre housbandis to loue vs weel
Al this sentence mee lykiht it everidel
Upe sterte the ꝑperdoner and that anoon
Now dame qd hee be god ⁊ bee seynt Iohn
Yee been a noble pꝰerchour in this caas
I was abowte to wedde a wyif alas
¶ What scholde I beye it on my flechs soo dere
Yit hadde I leuere to wedde no wyif to yeere
A byde qd sche my tale is nowgh be gunne
Nay thow schalt drynke of Annother Tvnne
Ore that I goo schal savoure wers thanne Ale
And whanne that I have toold foorht my tale
Of tribulacioun that I know in Mariage
Of whicche I am expert in myin age
¶ This is to seye my self hath been the wyghppe
Thanne mayst thow chese wher thow skyppe
Of thylke Tvnne that I schal A broche
Bee ware of hit or thow to neygh a proche
For I schal telle ensavnplis moo thanne ten
Whoo so that wil nowt be war by other men
¶ By hym schul other men corected bee
This same wordis writiht ptholome
Rede in his Almageste and take hit there
¶ Dame I wolde preye yow yif yowre wil were
Seyde this ꝑperdoner as yee bee gan
Telle foorht yowre tale spare for no man
And teche vs yonge men of yowre practike
¶ Gladlye qd schee sythe it may yow lyke
But that I preye to alle this cvmpanye
Yif that I speke after my fantasye
As takyht nowght Agreef of that I seye
For myn ententte is nowght but forto pleye
Now siris thanne schal I telle yow my tale
As evere mote I drinke wyin or ale
I schal seye sooht the hosebondis that I hadde
Three of hem were gode and two were badde
The thre were goode men and Riche and oolde
Vnnethe myghtte they the staat hoolde
In whiche they were bownden vnto mee
Yee woot wel what I mene in this ꝑperde
¶ As god me helpe I lawghe whanne I thenke
How pitously a nyght I made hem to swinke
But by my feyht I tolde of hit no store
They hadde me yeve here lond ⁊ here tresore
¶ Mee nedede nowght doo lengere diligence
To wynne here loue and do hem Reverence
They louede mee so wel by god a boue
That I ne toolde no deynte offe here loue
A wyis woman wil bysie hiere everichon
To gete hire loue there as sche hath noon
¶ But syhtthe I hadde hem holly in myn honde
And they hadde yeve mee al here londe
What scholde I take kepe hem to plese
¶ But yif it were my ꝓprofyht and myin eese
But I sette hem soo a werke bee my fay
That manye A nyght songe thy welawey
Thee bacvn was nowt fette for hem I trowe
That some men have in Esex at dvnmowe
¶ I governede hem so weel after my lawe
That eche of hem ful blive was and fawe
Too bryngge mee gaye thyngges fro the feyre
Knivis and Ryngis and purcis wel feyre
For god it woot I chide hem spituslye
¶ Now herkenyht how I baar mee proꝑperlye
Yee wyse wivis that can vnderstande
Thus scholde yee speke ⁊ bere hem on hande
For half so booldelye ther can no man
Swere and lye as can A womman
¶ I seye nowt this by wyuis that been wyse
But it bee whanne that they hem mys avise
Awyis wyif schal yif that sche can hiere goode
Bere hym on honde that thee Cowe is woode
And take witnesse of hiere owne Mayde
Offe hiere assent but herkene what I sayde
Sire oolde caynard is this thyine Array
Why is my neyghebouris wyif soo gay
Sche is honoured over a where sche gooht
¶ And I sitte at home I haue nowt a thrifty ch
What doost thow at myin neyghebouris hows
Is sche so feyir art thow soo Amerows
What Rowne yee wtith owre Mayde Bendicite
¶ Sire Oolde lechour lete thy iapis bee
And yif I have A gossippe or a freende
Whit owten gyltte yee shyden as a feende
¶ And yif that I walke or pleye home vnto his hows
Thow comest hom as drvnken as a Mows
And prechest on thy benche whit evel preeffe
Thow seyiste to mee hit is a greet mescheeffe
To wedde a pore womman for thee greet costage
And yif that schee bee Riche of greet parage
¶ Thanne seyist thow that it is A greet Turmēmtrie
To suffre hiere pride and hiere Malencolye
And yif that sche be fayir thow verray knave
Thow seyist that every holowr wole hiere haue
Schee may none while in chastite A byde
And that is assayed vppon everiche A syde
¶ Thow seyist that some folke desire vs for Richesse
Some for owre schap ⁊ some for owre fayirnesse
And some for schee can other synge or dawnce
Thus seyist thow wernard god yeve thee Meschawnce
Some for hiere handys and hiere armys smale
Thus gooht al to thee devele be thyin owne tale
¶ Thow seyist men may nowght kepe a castel wal
Hit may so longe Assayled been over al
And yif that sche bee fowle thow seyist that sche
Coveytiht everi man that schee may see
For as a spaynel schee wole on hym lepe
Til that schee fynde svm man that wole hiere chepe
Ther is noo gray goos that gooht in thee Lake
As seyst thow that wole be wtith owten A make
¶ Thow seyist it is an hard thyng forto weelde
A wyght that no man wil his thankys heelde
Thus seyst thow lorel whanne thow gost to bedde
And that no wyse man nedyht nowght to wedde
And no man that entendyht to thee hevene
Wtith wyilde thunder dent And fyeris leuene
Mote thyin welked necke be to broke
¶ Thow seyst that droppyng howsis ⁊ eke smoke
And chydinge wyvis make men to flee
Owt of here owne howsis A benedicite
What eyliht swiche an Oolde man forto chyde
¶ Thw seyst wee wyvis wil owre vicys hyde
Til wee been faste ⁊ thanne wole wee hem schewe
Weel may this bee the ꝓproverbe offe a schrewe
Thw seyist that Oxen Assen hors and howndis
They been assayd atte divers stoundis
¶ Bacyins laveris or that men hem beye
Sponis stolis And swiche housbondrye
And so been pottis klothis and other haraeys
But offe wōmmen are maade noon assays
Til they been wedded Oolde dotard schrewe
And seyst thanne wole wee owre vycis schewe
¶ Thow seyst Also that it displesyht mee
But yif that thow wolt preyse my bewtee
And but thow powre al wey vppon my face
And klepe mee feyre dame in every a place
¶ And but yif thow make a feeste on that ilke day
That I was borne ⁊ make me frechs and gay
And but thow doo to myn nvrce honowr
And to my Chavmber wtith inne my bowr
And to my fadris folke and to his Alyes
Thus seyst thow Oolde barel ful of lyis
¶ And yit to owre aprentyis Iankyn
For his Cryspe heer schinynge so gold fyin
And for that hee squieriht mee bothe vp ⁊ down
And yit hast thow a fals suspeciovn
I wil hym nowght yif thow were deed to morwe
But tel mee this why hydest thow wtith sorwe
Thy keyis of thy cheste A wey froo mee
Hit is my good as weel as thyin parde
¶ What wenest thow to make An Ideot of owre dame
Now by that lord that klepid is seyint Iame
Thow schalt nowt bothe / thowgh that thow were wood
Bee Mayster of my body and eke of my good
That Oon thow schalt fore go Maugre thyne Eeyen
What nedyht hit on mee to enqueren and spien
¶ I trowe thow woldest loke mee in thy cheste
Thow schuldest sey wyif goo where as thee leste
Take yowre desporte I wil leue no talis
I knowe yow fore a good wyif dame Alis
Wee loue no man that takyht kepe or charge
Where that wee goo we wole bee atte owre large
Of alle men on lyue blessed mote hee bee
The wyse astrologen daun ꝓprotholome
That seyht this proverbe in his Almageste
Of al men his wyisdom is heyeste
That Reckyht nevere who hath the world in hande
By this proverbe thow schalt wel vnderstande
Haue yee I nowgh what thar thee recke ore Care
How merily that evere other folke fare
¶ For Certis Oolde dotard by yowre leve
Yee schulle have queynte I nowe at eve
He is to greet A nygard that wole werne
A man to lyghtte a candle atte his lanterne
He schal have nevere thee lasse lyght ꝑperde
Haue thow I nowgh thee thar nowt pleyne thee
¶ Thow seyst also that yif thow makyst vs gay
Wtith klothynge ore wtith other precious Aray
That is greet perel fore owre chastite
And yit wtith wordis thow most enforce mee
And seye this wordis in the Apostelis name
In abyte maad wtith chastite and schame
Yee women schulde aparayle yow quod hee
And nowght in tressed heer and gay perre
¶ As perls ne whit golde ne klothis Riche
After thy text ne after thy Reubriche
I wil nowt werke as mechil as a gnatt
Thow seydest also that I was lyike a Catt
But whoo so wolde senge a Cattis skyn
Thanne wolde thee Catt weel dwellen in his In
¶ And yif thee cattis skyn be slyke and gay
Schee ne wil nowt dwelle in the hows half a day
But foorht she wole ore any day bee dawed
Too schewe hiere skyn and goon a cater wawed
This is forto seye yif bee gay sire schrewe
That I wole renne owt my borel for to schewe
Sire Oolde fool what helpyht thee to A spyen
