¶ And whanne they were come in too
thee presence of Melibe hee seyde hem thyse wordis

¶ It standeht thus quod Melibe and sooht it
is that yee
causeles and wtith owte skyle a resoūn

haven doon Iniuries and wrongis to mee ⁊ to my
wyif prudence and to my dowghtter also
for yee haven entred into myin hows by vyolence

and
have doon swich owtrage that all men knowen weel that yee haue deserved thee deth

⁊ there-
fore wole I knowe of yow and wyte of yow

wheyther yee wole putte thee punyssyngge ⁊ chas-
tisyngge and thee vengeaunce of this owtrage in thee will of mee and of my wyif ore yee
wole nowght //
Thanne thee wyseste of hem three ansswerde for hem alle and seyde

sire qd
hee wee knowen weel that wee been vnworthy for to come vnto thee cowrt of soo greete a
lord and soo worthy as yee been

for wee haue soo greetlye mystaken vs and haven offendid
and a gylt in swiche a wyse a geynst yowre heye lordschipe

that trewly wee haven desserved
thee deet /

but yit fore thee greet goodnesse and debonayrtee that alle thee world witnessyht /
of yowre ꝑpersone

wee submitten vs to thee exellence and benygnitee of yowre gracious lord-
schepe
and wee been redy to obeye to alle yowre comavndementtis

bysekyngge yow that offe
yowre Merciable pitee that yee wole considere owre greet repentaunce and lowe submyssyoūn
and graunte vs for yevensse of owre owtragious trespas ⁊ offence

for weell wee knowen that
yowre lyberall grace and mercy strecchen henne ferthere in to goodnesse / thanne doon owre owt-
taragious gyltes and trespas into wyckednesse

all bee hit that cursedly and dampnably wee haven
agilt ageynst yowre heye lordschipe

¶ Thanne Melibe toke hen vp fro thee grownde ful benig-
nelye

and resseyvede here obbligaciounis and here bondis by here othes vppon here pleggis ⁊ bore-
wys /
and assygned hem a certeyn day to retourne vn to his cowrt

for to accepte and resseyven
thee sentence and Iugement that Melibe wolde comovnde to bee doon on hem by thee causes
aforn seyd /
wiche thyngis ordeynede every man returnede to his hows

¶ And whanne that
dame Prudence sawgh hiere tyme schee freynede ⁊ askede hiere lord Melibe

what venge-
aunce hee thowghtte to taken of his adversaries

¶ To whiche Melibe ansswerde and seyde
¶ Certis quod hee I thenke and purpose mee fullye

forto desserite hem of all that evere they
haven and forto putte hem in exile for evere more

¶ Certis quod dame Prudence this w-
ere a crewell sentence a mochell ageyn resoun

for yee been riche I nowgh and yee haue no
nede of other mennys good

And yee myghtte lyghtlye in this wyse geten yow a coveytous na-
me
wiche that is a vicious thyng and awghtte to been eschewyd of every good man

for aftꝰer
thee sawe or thee word of thee apostel coveytise is rote of alle harmes

¶ And theer fore
it were bettere for yow to lese so mochell good of yowre owne thanne forto take of here
good in this manere

for bettere it is to lese good wtith worschepe thanne it is to wynne good
wtith velenye and schame

and every man owghtte to doon his diligence and his bisinesse to ge-
te hym a good name
and yit schall nowt oonly bisie hym in kepynge of his good name

but
hee schall also en force hym alwey to svm thyng by wyche hee may renovele his good na-
me

¶ For it is wreten in Oolde cronykelis of Oolde bookys that good loos ore good name of
a man it is sone goon and passed whanne it is nowght newed no renovellid

⁊ as towchyngge
that yee seyn yee wole exile yowre adveraryis

that thynkiht mee mochell ageyn resoūn ⁊ owt
offe mesewre
considered thee power that they haue yeven to yow vppon hem self

and it is wre-
tyn that hee is worthy to leson his prevylage that mys vseht thee myght and thee power that
is yeeven hym

¶ And I sette caas yee myghtte enioyne hem that peyne by ryght and by
lawe
thee wyche I trowe yee may nowt doo

I seye yee myghtte nowght nowt putten it
to execucioūn ꝑperaventure
and thanne were it lyiklye to retorne to thee werre as it was by forne
and theerfore yif yee wole that men doon yow obeysaunce yee moste deme more curteysly
¶ This is to seyn yee moste yeve more esy sentencis and Iuggementis

for it is wretyn th-
at hee that most curteisly comavndyht to hym moste men obeye

and theer fore I praye yow
that in this necessitee ⁊ in this nede yee caste yow to overcome yowre owne hertte

¶ Fore
senek seyht hee that overcomyht his hertte hee overcomyht twyis /

And tullius seyht th-
er is no thyng soo comendable in a greet lord

as whanne hee is deboneyre and meke ⁊
appesyht hym self lyghttly
and preye yow that yee wole forbere now to doo vengeaunce

in
swiche a manere that yowre good name may been kepte and conservid /

and that men mowe
haue cause ⁊ matere to preyse yow of pitee and of Mercy

and that yee haue no cause to
repente yow of thyngis that yee doon

¶ For senek seyht that hee overcomyht in an e-
vel manere that repentyht hym of his victorie

wheerfore I preye yow late Mercy been
in yowre hertte

to theffecte and entente that god almyghtty haue Mercy on yow in his
laste Iugement

¶ For seynt Iame seyht in his epistle Iugement wtith owten Mercy schal
bee doon to hym that hath no Mercy of another wyght

¶ whanne Melibe hadde herd thee grete
skyles ⁊ resounys of dame Prudence ⁊ hiere wyse enformacionis

⁊ his hertte gan to encly-
ne to thee will of his wyif consideryngge hiere trewe entente

cōmformyngge hym anoon and
assentede fully to werkyn after hiere cvnseyl

and thankede god of whom ꝓprosedyht al vertew and
goodnesse that hym sente a wyif of soo greet discrecioūn //

and whanne thee day com that his
adversaries scholde appere in his pꝰersence
hee spak vnto hem full goodly and seyde in this wyse
all bee hit soo that of yowre piride ⁊ hey pꝰersvmsioūn and folye and of yowre necligence

yee haue mys-
born yow and trespased vnto mee /
yit for as moche as I see ⁊ byholde yowre greet humylite

⁊ that
yee been sory and repentaunt of yowre gyltis
it constreyniht mee to do yow grace ⁊ mercy

wh-
erfore I resseyue yow to my garace

⁊ for yeve yow owterly all thee offens Iniuries and wrongys
that yee haue doon a geyn mee and myne

to this effecte and to this ende that god of his en-
dlees mercy

wole atte thee tyme of owre deyinge for yeve vs owre gyltis that wee haue tr-
espacid vnto hym in this wrecched worlde

for dowtles yif wee bee sory and repentaunt of the
synnis ⁊ gylttis wyche wee haue trespased in thee syghtte of owre lord god

hee is so free ⁊ soo
Mercyable
that hee wole for yeve vs owre giltis

and brynge vs to thee blisse that nevere schall
eende Amen

div.l: Whane ended was this tale of Melibe
And of prudence ⁊ of hire benignite
Owre hoste seyde as I am a feyhtful man
And by thee precious corpus madrian
I hadde leuere thanne a barell of good ale
That good leve my wyif hadde herd this tale
For schee ne is nothyng of swich pacience
As was was this Melibeus wyif prudence
By goddis bonys whanne I bete my knavis
Schee bryngyht mee thee greete clubbed stavis
And crieht slee thee doggys everichon
And brake hem bothe backe and bon
And yif that eny neyghebour of myne
Wole nowt in Cherche to My wyif encline
Or bee soo hardy to hiere to trespace
Whanne sche comyht hoom schee remiyht īn my face
And crieht fals cowarde awreke thy wyif
By corpus bonys I wole haue thy knyif
And thow schalt have my distaf and goo spynne
Froo day to nyght Ryght thus schee wole begynne
Allas schee seyht that evere was I schape
To wedde a Melk sop or so greet an apee
That wole been overlad wtith every wyght
Thow darst nowt stande by thy wyif aryght
This is my lyif but yif I wolde fyghtte
And owt atte thee dore anoon I moote mee dyghtte
Or ellis I am lost but yif that I
Bee lyike a wylde lyovn foule hardy
I woot weel schee wole doon mee slee svm day
Svm neyghebour and thanne to goo my way
For I am ꝑperilus whit knyif on honde
All bee it that I dare here nowt wtith stonde
For schee is bygge in armes bee my feyht
That schall hee fynde that hiere mysseyht
But late vs pasce over of this matere
My lord sire Mvnke hee seyht bee merye of chere
For yee schall telle a tale sire trewly
Lo Rovchestre standyht heere faste by
Ryde foorht myin owne lord brekyht not yowre game
But by my trowthe I knowe nowt yit yowre name
Wheyther I schall calle yow my lord daun Iohn
Or daun Thomas or ellis daun alboūn
Of what hows bee yee by yowre fader kyn
I avowe to god thow hast a full feyir skyn
Hit is a gentel pasture theere thow goost
Thow ne art nowt lyke a pente or a goost
Vppon my feyht thow art svm officere
Svm worthy sexteyn or svm selerere
For by my faderis sowle as to my dome
Thow art a mayster whanne thow art at home
Noo pore cloysterere no pore novyce
But governowr bothe wily and wyise
And theer wtith all of brawne and of bonis
A weel feyir ꝑpersone for thee nonyis
I preye to god yeve hym confusioun
That ferst thee browghtte in to religyoun
Thow woldest haue been a tredefowl a Ryght
Haddest thow as greet leeve as thow hast myght
To ꝑperforme all thy lust in Engendreure
Thow heddest by getyn manye a creature
Allas why werest thow so wyde a cope
God yeve mee sorwe and I were a poope
Nowght oonly thow but every myghtty man
Thowgh hee were schore an heygh on the pan
Scholde haue a wyif for all this world is lorn
Religioūn hath taken vp all thee corn
Of tredyngge ⁊ we borell men been schrympis
Offe feble treis comyht wrecched yimpis
This makyht owre children forto been so sklendre
And feble that they may nowt weel engendre
This makyht that owre wyivis wole assaye
Religeus folk for they may better paye
Of venvs payment thanne may wee
God woot no lusscheburwes paye yee
But beeht nowt wrooht my lord yif that I pleye
Full often in game a sooht haue I herd seye
This worthy Mvnke toke alle in pacience
And seyde I wole doon all my diligence
All so feer as sownyht in to honeste
To telle yow a tale or two or three
And yif yow liste to herken hiderward
I wole yow seye thee lyif of seynt Edward
Or ellys tregedys ferst wole I telle
Of wiche I have an hvndred in my selle
Tregedys is for to telle a certeyn storie
As oolde bokys maken offe memorye
Of hem that stonden in greet prosperite
And is falle owt of hey degre
In to miserie and endede wrecchedly
And they been vercefyed comevnly
Of sex feete that men clepen Examytroūn
In prose also been endited manye oon
And eke of metev in many svndre wyse
Lo this owghtte yow I nowgh suffise
Now herkenyht yif yow leste it forto here
But ferst I yow beseke in this matere
Thowgh I by ordre telle nowt these thyngis
Bee it of popis Emꝑperowris or kynggis
And after here agee as men wryte fynde
But telle some by fore ⁊ some by hind
As it comyht now to my remenbrwnce
Haue mee now excused of myin ignoraunce
¶ Explicit ꝓprologe
¶ here bee gynnyht thee talee
I wole by wayle in thee manere of tregedye
Thee harme of hym that standyht īn hey degre
And fallen so that theer ne was no remedye
To brynge hem owt of here advercite
For certeyn whanne fortune leste to flee
Theer may no man of here thee cours be holde
Late no man truste on blynde properitee
Beeht war by thys ensample yonge ⁊ oolde
At lucifer thowgh hee an awngel were
And nowt a man at hym wole I begynne
For yowre fortune ne may noon awngel dere
From heye degree yit fell hee for his synne
Down in to helle where as hee is yit inne
Oo lucifer bryghttest of awngelys alle
Now art thow sathanas that mayst not twinne
Owt of miserie in wiche thow art falle
Loo Adama in thee feelde of damascene
Wtith goddis owne fynger wroute was hee
And nowght by geten of mānnys stre vnklene
That welte all ꝑperadyis savyngge oo tree
Hadde nevere wordly man so heygh degree
As adama hadde all hee fore his governawnce
Was dreven owt of his heyghe prosꝑperitee
To laboure vnto helle and to meschavnce
Loo sampson thee wiche was annvnciat
By thee awngell longe or his natiuitee
And was to god al myghtty consecrat
Was nevere swich a nother as was hee
And stood in noblesse while hee myghtte see
To speke of strengthe ⁊ therto of hardinesse
But to his wyvis toolde hee his previtee
Thorghw wiche hee slowe hym for wrecchednesse
S sampson thee noble and myghtty champirioūn
Wtith owte wepene saue his handis tweyne
Hee slowe and al to rente thee lyoun
Towardis his weddyngge wakynge by the weye
His false wyif cowde hym so plese ⁊ preye
Tille schee his cvnseyll knewe ⁊ schee vntrewe
Vnto his foos his cvnseyill schee gan to by wrey
And hym for sooke ⁊ toke a nother newe
An hundred foxis toke sampson for yre
And alle here taylis hee to geder bonde
And sette thee foxis taylis alle on fyre
For hee in every tayil hadde putte a bronde
And they brenten all thee cornys in that londe
And alle here olyves and here vines eke
A thowsand mēm hee slowe also wtith his honde
And hadde no wepene but an assis cheke
Whanne they weren slayen to sore hym thurstede that hee
Was weell ney lorn for wich hee gan topreye
That god wolde of his Mercy haue svm pitee
And sende hym drynk or ellis moste hee deye
And of this asses cheke that was soo dreye
Owt of a wang tooht spronge anoon awelle
Of wich hee dronke I nowgh schortlye to seye
Thus halp hym god as Ivdiciūn can telle
By verray force atte gasoūn on anyght
Mawgre philistiens of that Citee
Thee gate of thee to wit hee hath vp plyght
And on his backe I caried it hath hee
Heye on an hill where as men myghtte see
Oo noble ⁊ myghtty sampsoūn leef and dere
Nee haddest thow toold the woman thy secree
In all this world ne hadde been thy pere
This sampsoūn nevere syther dronk no wyin
No on his heede ne cam raser noon ne schere
By pꝰersepte of thee messageer devyin
For all his strengthe was in his heere
And fully twenty yeere by yeere
Hee hadde of Israell thee governaunce
But sone after schall hee wepe manye a tere
For womēmn schull brynge hym to myschaunce
Unto his lemman dalida hee tolde
That in his heris all his strengthe lay
And falslye to his foomen schee hym soolde
And slepyngge in hiere barm vppon a day
Schee made to clyppe or schere his heere away
And made his foomen all his crafte Aspien
And whanne they hym fonde in swiche arraye
They bonde hym faste and putte owt his Eeyen
But ere his heed was clipped or I schave
Theer was no bond that myghtte hym byinde
But now is hee in presoūn putte in Akave
Where as they made hym atte thee querne grynde
Oo noble sampsoūn strengest of mankynde
Oo whilvm Iugge in glorie and Richesse
Now mayst thow wepe wtith thyn Eeyen blynde
Syhtthen thow art fallen into wrecchednesse
Thee ende of these caytivis was as schall saye
His foo men maden a feeste vppon a day
And made hym as here fool by fore hem pleye
This was in a temple of greet array
But atte thee laste hee made afowl affray
For hee two postis shoke and made hem falle
And a down fell thee temple and all theer it lay
And slowe hym self and eke his fomen alle
This is thee ende of thee pirincys everichon
And also a thousand bodies were ther slayn
Wtith fallyngge of thee greete temple of ston
Of sampsoūn wole I no more sayn
Bee waar of this ensamplis oolde ⁊ playn
That no man tell her cvnsseyll to here wyvis
Of swich thyng as they wolde haue secre fayn
Yif that it towche here lymes oo here lyvis
Of Ercule thee sovereyn conquerowr
Sygnede his werkys and heye renown
For in his tyme of strengthe hee baar the flowr
Hee slow ⁊ byrafte thee skyn froo thee lyown
Hee of seynt awres leyde thee beste a down
Hee arpies slowe thee crowell bridde felle
Hee the golden apples caste thee dragow
Hee drew owte serberoys thee hownd of helle
Hee slowe thee crewell tyraunt Buferous
And made his hors to frete hym flessh ⁊ boon
Hee slowe the verray serpent venymous
Of achilles two hornys brake that oon
And hee slowe Cacus in a cave of stoon
Hee slowe thee Geaunt anteus thee stronge
Hee slowe thee grisly bore and that anoon
And bare hee his heed vppon his necke boon
Was nevere wyght sytthen the world be gan
That dede soo manye Maystries as dede hee
Thorghw owt thys wyde world his name ran
What for his strengthe and his bountee
And into every a Reawme wentte hee forto see
Hee was so strong no man myghtte hym lette
And atte thee worldis eende as seyht Trophee
In stede of boundis hee a piler sette
A leman hadde this noble champioun
That heyghtte dyaniyre as frechs as May
And as thee Clerkys maden Menciovn
Schee hath hym sent a schertte frechs ⁊ gay
Allas his schertte and weylaway
Envenymed was hee svbtelly wtith alle
That ere hee hadde wered hit half aday
Hit made his bonis froo his flechs to falle
But natheles some Clerkys here excusyht
By oon that heyghte Nessus that hit makede
Bee as it bee may I wole hiere nat accusen
But on his bake thee sherte hee werede all nakede
Till that his flesschs was for thee venym blakede
And whanne hee sawe noon other remedy
In hote colis hee hath hym selfe rakede
For whiche no venym deynede hym to dey
Thus starf this worthy myghtty Ercules
Loo whoo may truste on fortune any throwe
For hym that all this worlde folewyht of prees
Ere hee bee warre is ofte leyd full lowe
Full wyis is hee that hym self can knowe
By warre for whanne that fortune luste to glose
Thanne wayteht schee here man down to throwe
By swiche awey as hee leest wolde suppose
Thee myghtty trone thee precious tresoure
Thee gloriouse septre and Riall Magestee
¶ That hadde thee Kyng Nabygodonosor
Wtith tvngge vnnethe may discreved bee
Hee twyes wan Ierlm that Citee
Thee vesselis of thee temple wtith hym ladde
Atte Babyloyne was his sovereyn see
In wich his glorie ⁊ his delyte hee hadde
Thee feyreste children of thee blood ryall
Of Ierlm hee dede do gylden anoon
And made eche of hem to been his thrall
Amonges alle othere daniell was oon
That was wyseste chyild of everichon
For hee thee dremys of thee kyng dede exponde
Wheere as in caldye Clerkys were theer noon
That wiste to what fyine his dremys sownede
This prowd kyng leet make a statue of gold
Sixty cubites in lengthe and sevene in brede
To wiche iche ymage bothe yonge ⁊ oolde
Comavndede hee to lowte and to haue in drede
Ore in a fvrneys full of flamys Reede
Hee scholde been brente that wolde not obeye
But nevere wolde assentte to that dede
Danyell no his felawys tweye
This kyng was prowde and elate
Hee wende god that sit in Magestee
That myght haue hym putte fro his estate
But sodeynlye hee loste his dygnitee
And lyike a beeste hym semede for to bee
And Eet heye as an Oxe and lay theer owte
In reyn wtith wyilde beestis walkede hee
Tille certeyn tyme were comen wte
And lyke an Egles fetheris was his heris
His naylis lyik briddis clawes were
God relevede hym at certeyn yeris
And yaf hym wyt ⁊ Cheer wtith manye a teere
Hee thanked god and evere his lyif in feere
Was hee to doon a mys ore more to trespace
And oo tyme that hee leyd was on his bere
Hee knew weell that god was full of myght ⁊ grace
His sone wiche that heyghte Baltasar
That heeld thee regne after his faderis daye
Hee by his fader covlde nowght bee warre
For prowd hee was in hertte and of Arraye
And also an Idolastre was hee aye
His heye estate assurede hym in pryde
But fortune caste hym down and theer he laye
And sodeynlye his regne by gan devide
A feeste hee made vnto his lordis alle
Vppon a tyme hee made hem blithe to bee
Foorht thanne his officeris gan hee calle
Cvm bryngeht forht thee vesselis qd hee
Wiche that my fader in his prosperitee
Owt of thee temple of Ierlm by rafte
And to owre heye goddis thanke wee
Of honowre that owre elderis wtith vs lafte
His wyif his lordis and his concubynes
Ay they drynke whiles here appetyt wole laste
Owt of this noble vesselis svndry wynis
This Baltasar on a wall his Eeyen caste
And sawe an hand armles that wroot full faste
For fere of wich hee quoke ⁊ sikede sore
This hond that Baltasar made so sore a gaste
Wroot Mane techel phares and no more
In all that londe Magican was theer noon
That cowde expoune what this lettre mente
But danyell expounede hit anoon
And seyde kyng god to thy fader sentte
Glorie ⁊ honowre Regne tresour ⁊ rentte
And hee was prowd ⁊ no thyng god ne dradde
And there fore god greet wreche vppon hym sentte
And hym by rafte thee regne that hee hadde
Hee was owt cast of mannys cvmpanye
Whit assys was his Abitacioun
And Eete hey as a beeste in wete ⁊ dreye
Tille that hee knewe by grace ⁊ good Resoun
That god of hevene hath dominacioun
Over every Regne and every creature
And thanne hadde god of hym cvmpascioun
And hym restorede his regne in his figure
Also thow that aree his sone and prowd also
And knowest all this thyngis previly
And rebell to god and art his foo
Thow drankest also of his vesselis boldely
Thy wyif eke and thy wenchis senfully
Dronke of thee same vessell svndry wynis
And heried false goddis cursedly
Theerfore to thee schapen grete peyne is
Thee hond was sent fro god that on the wall
Wroot Mane techel phares trustyht mee
Thy regne is doo thow weldest it nowt at all
Devided is thy Regne and it schall bee
To Medes and to perces yeven qd hee
And thilke same nyght thee kyng was slawe
And daries ocupyeht his degree
Thowgh hee therto hadde nowther Ryght ne law
Lordyngis herby ensample may yee take
How that in lordschepe is no sikernesse
For whānne fortewne wole a man forsake
Hee beryht awey his Regne ⁊ his richesse
And also his freendis bothe more and lesse
And whānne a man hath frendis thorghw fortun
Mishap wole make hym enemyes I gesse
This ꝓproverbe is full sooht and comvne
Cenobia of palamere thee Quene
As writen Psyens of here noblesse
So worthy was in armes and so kene
That no wyght passede hiere in hardinesse
No in lynage no in other gentelnesse
Of thee kynggis blood of pers is sche descendid
I seye schee ne hadde nowt most feyirnesse
But of hiere schap schee myghtte nat be amēmdid
Fro chyidhode I fynde that schee fledde
Office of woman ⁊ in to thee wod schee wentte

This Chauntekler whanne hee hym gan asspie

I am comyn yowre cvnseyl forto a spie

And theer wtith yee haue in mvsyk more felyngge

And forto make his veyis thee more strang
Hee wolde so peyne hym that wtith bothe his Eeyen
He moste wynke so dede hee Cryen
And stonde on his tiptoūn theer wtith all
And strecche foorht his necke long and small
And also hee was of swich discrecioūn
That theer was no man in no regioūn
That in song or wysdom myghtte hym pasce
I have wel often red daun burnel thee rasce
Amongis his vers I fynde theer was akoc
And fore a preestis sone yaf hym a knoc
Vppon his leg whilys hee was yong ⁊ nice
Hee made hym forto lese his benifice
But certeyn theer is noo conparisoūn
By twixe thee wyisdom and diskressioūn
Of yowre fader and of his subtillitee
Now synge on sire for seynt charitee
Late vs see cvnne yee yowre fader counterfete
This Chauntekler his wynggis gan to bete
As man that cowde nowt his tresoun asspie
Soo was hee ravessched wtith his flatrye
Alas yee lordis manye a fals flaterowr
Is in yowre covrt and manye a losengeowr
That plesen yow more bee my feyht
Thanne hee that soohtfastnesse vnto yow seyht
Redyht ecclesiastre how hee seyht of flatrie
Beeht waar yee lordis of here trecherye
This Chauntekler stoode heye vppon his tois
Strecchyngge his necke ⁊ heeld his Eeyen cloos
And gan to crowe lowde for thee nonys
And daun Russell sterte vp all attonys
And by thee gargage hee hentte Chauntekler
And on his bac towardis thee wode hym beer
For yit was theer no man that hym sewede
Oo destenye that mayst nowt been eschewyd
Alas that Chauntekler fell froo thee bemys
For his wyif rowghtte nowt of dremys
Oo venus that art goddesse of plesaunce
Sehtthis that thy servaunt was this Chauntekler
And in thy servise dede alle his poweer
More for delyte thanne fore thee worldis Multiplye
Why woldest thow svffre hym on thy day to deye
Oo Gaufrede dere mayster soverayne
That whanne worthy kyng Richard was slayne
Wtith schotte thow complaynest his deeht so sore
Why ne hadde O now thy sentence ⁊ thy lore
Thee fryday for to chyde as dede yee
For on a fryday schortlye slayn was hee
Thanne wolde I schewe how that I cowde playne
For Chavntekler and for his greet payne
Certis swich cry no swich lamentacioun
Was noōm maad of ladyis whan that yleon
Was wonne ⁊ pirrus wtith his streyght swerd
Whanne he hentte kyng prian bee thee berd
And hadde slayn hym as seyde Envideos
As made alle thee hennys in thee cloos
Whanne they hadde seye of Chauntekler the syghtte
But sovereyn dame prertilote schryghtte
Weell loudere thanne dede hasdrubaldis wyif
Whanne that hiere housbande hadde lost his lyif
And that thee Romaynis hadde brent cartage
Schee was so full of turment and of rage
That wilfullye in to thee fyer sche sterte
And brentte here self wtith a stedefast hertte
Oo wofull hennys Ryght sore cride yee
As they whanne Nero brentte thee Citee
Of Rome criden thee senatoris wyvis
For that here housbandis scholde lese here livis
Wtith owten gylt Nero hath hem slayn
Now wole I turne to my tale a gayn
¶ This sely wydwe ⁊ hiere dowghttris twoo
Herden thee hennys crie and make woo
And owt at thee dore stertte they anoon
And sawen thee fox to thee wode goon
And bare vppon his bac the koc wtith hym awey
They criden owt and harrow and well a wey
Ha ha thee fox and after hym they ran
And also wtith stavys manye another man
Thane ran colle owre dogge Talboot ⁊ garlond
And Malkyn wtith here disstaf in hiere hond
Ran cow ⁊ calf and eke thee verray hoggys
Ryght sore afered for berkyngge of thee doggys
And schowtynge of men and of women ekee
They ran soo theyim thowghtte here hertte brkee
They yelleden as feendis doon in helle
They cryden on here doggys as mēm wolde hem kelle
Owt of thee hevis come thee swerme of beis
The gees for feere flowen over thee treyis
Soo hydows was thee noyse a Benedicitee
Certis hee Iacke straw and his meyne
Ne made nevere schowtis half / so schrille
Whanne they wolde any flemyng kylle
As that ilke day was maad vppon thee fox
Of bras they browghtten bemys and of box
Of horn and boone in wiche they povpede
And theere wtith all they schrichede ⁊ howpede
Hit semede as that hevene scholde falle
Now goode men I preye yow herkenyht alle
Loo how that fortune turnyht sodeynlye
For hope and eke for piride of here envye
This koc that lay vppon thee foxis bac
In all his drede to thee fox he spac
And seyde sire yif that I were as yee
Yit scholde I seye as wis god helpe mee
Turne a yeen yee prowde Cherlis alle
A verray pestilens vppon yowre bodyis falle
Now am I come vnto this wodis syde
Mavgre of yow alle here hee schall a byde
I wole hym hym Eete in feyht ⁊ that anoon
Thee fox ansswerde in feyiht it schal bee doon
And hee spake that word all sodeynly
This koc brake froo his mowht sodeynly
And an heygh vppon a tree hee fleygh a noon
And whan thee fox saw that hee was a goon
Allas quod hee Oo Chauntekler allas
I have doon to yow qd hee a greet tespas
In as moche as I made yow a ferd
Whane I hentte yow to brynge yow owtith of the yerd
But I ne dede hit in no wicked entente
Comeht down ⁊ I wille telle what I mente
And I schall seye sooht so god helpe mee soo
Nay qd hee thanne I schrewe vs bothe twoo
And ferst I schrewe my self bothe blood ⁊ bonis
Yif that thow bee gile mee oftere thanne onis
Thow schalt no nomore wtith thy fals flatrye
To doo mee syngge and wynke wtith myin Eeye
Hee that wynkyht whanne hee scholde see
As wistlye god late hym nevere thee
Nay quod thee fox god yeve hym meschavnce
That is soo vn deskreet of his governawnce
That Iangelyht whanne hee scholde bee in pees
Loo wyche hit is forto beene Rechelees
And necligent and to truste in flaterye
But yee that hoolde this greet folye
As offe a fox of a koc and offe an hen
Takyht thee Moralite goode men
For seynt Powle seyht all that wretyn is
To owre doctrine hit is wretyn I wis
Takyht thee Corne ⁊ late thee Chaf / bee stille
Now goode god and it bee yowre wille
Of yowre grace lord make vs all goode men
And brynge vs alle to his heyghe blisse amen

Of Clerkis for I am nowght text well
I take but thee sentence trustyth weell
Theer fore I make now a protestacioun
That I wole stonde alwey to coreccioun
Vppon this word wee have assentid sone
For as it semede it was forto done
To Eenden in sum vertuous sentence
And for to yeve hym space and audience
And bad owre Oste scholde to hym seye
That all wee to telle his tale hym preye
Owre Oste hadde thee wordis for vs all
Sire preest quod hee now feyre mote thee be fall
Sey what yow lust and wee schull gladly here
And wtith that word hee seyde in this manere
Tellyht quod hee yowre meditacioūn
But hastyht yow for thee svnne wole a down
Beht fructuous and that in lytell space
And to doon weell god sende yow of his grace
¶ And here Endyht thee Prologe of the tale
